title: Full Stack Developer
description:
Personal, different, and kind. That’s the essence of Teamtailor. And that’s how we try to make recruiting a joy by giving companies tools to attract and hire the right talent. To provide a caring candidate experience that will help people find their dream jobs. 50,000 people are hired through the Teamtailor platform every month.

  

With your help we can take that even further. Towards a world where everyone wakes up and goes to work with a smile on their face.

  

Our product is shaped by our culture. We think that transparency and collaboration leads to creativity and ownership. That’s how we work at Teamtailor and that’s what we try to unlock for our users too. We don't just accept difference — we celebrate it, we support it, and we thrive on it for the benefit of our culture and our product. Our team comes from a wide range of backgrounds, and we're committed to equal opportunity and inclusivity.

  

As a developer in the Product team you will experience this first hand, every day. We don’t believe in micro-management (heck, we barely believe in management) or control. We believe in alignment and autonomy. In working together towards meaningful goals and empowering everyone in the team to make the decisions on how to get there.

  

We’ve been using the Shape Up methodology for many years now to help us support that. We work in small teams of 3 — two full stack developers and one designer — that collaborate closely during a six week cycle to design, build, and ship the best possible solution to a project. A project that has a clear goal, a rich context, and helpful constraints. You can read more about the details in our post Building Teamtailor — How We Work in the Product Team. And check out the highlights from one of our recent cycles to learn more about what types of projects we work on.

  

After the cycle we have a two week cooldown period split into two parts: Innovation Week, where we shift focus from shipping to collaborating on experiments. The goal is to try new ideas together to learn and have fun. Then, Improvement Week, where we tackle lots of different improvements in our user interface, codebase, and tools. Small things that together have a big impact. Then we are ready for the next cycle to begin.

  

We are close to 50 people in the Product team, distributed across Sweden, Poland, Turkey, Spain, Portugal, and Hungary. An incredible group of caring and competent colleagues. We work in a hybrid remote fashion, where everyone is free to work from wherever they want, but we believe in hiring in clusters and will prioritise candidates in locations where we have an office. That way people can easily meet up when they want. To work closely together in-person or just have fun. We also invest heavily in this with our Workaway concept, where everyone on the team has a budget for self-organized team trips. Team members have used this to meet up in places like Istanbul, Kraków, Ericeira, Amsterdam, Mallorca, and Stockholm to name just a few examples. You can read more in our post Workaway in Portugal — Building Connections in a Distributed Team.

  

Here’s what some of our colleagues have to say about working in the Product team at Teamtailor:

  

“It’s a joy to work in this close-knit team of passionate and talented people to build the best product for our users and their candidates.”
  

— Suzan Dil, Head of Product


“As a part of the product team here, my role involves a variety of tasks, including working on different exciting projects through our cycles that aim to make our users and their candidates experience better. At the end of every cycle, we have an innovation week where incredible ideas have the chance to come to life and become a part of the final product. It all gives me the opportunity to express my creativity, collaborate with friendly and highly skilled colleagues, take on important responsibilities, all while thoroughly having fun. ”
  

— Viktor Ceginskas, Full Stack Developer


“Joining Teamtailor recently, I was really impressed with the onboarding process — from receiving an email two weeks in advance with the detailed schedule for the first working weeks to having a Teamtailor academy where you can learn everything about the product. And, fun events where I got to know my new colleagues better, for example, by playing the Pétanque game. As soon as you enter the Stockholm office, you will meet the kindest team in the whole HR industry.  

I joined a team of four, finished one small project, and started working on a larger one. So what can I say? My journey to the Ruby on Rails world started, towards Rails mastery.”
  

— Julia Dizhak, Full Stack Developer

**Is this right for you?**
--------------------------

* Do you want to work in a supportive environment with the freedom and flexibility to find the right balance and way of working for you?
* Do you thrive with autonomy, taking ownership of projects and collaborating with your teammates to deliver meaningful outcomes?
* Do you care deeply about building products that users love, and are you motivated by the impact that can have on their lives?
* Do you love learning new things, growing and improving your skills driven by your curiosity and the mentorship of supportive colleagues?
* Do you know **Ruby on Rails and Ember.js**, or do you have enough experience with similar technologies to learn them quickly?

If you answered Yes to all of those questions, then this job could be a good fit for you, and we encourage you to apply!

**This is a hybrid position, and right now we prioritising candidates in Stockholm, Gothenburg, or Linköping. We are unable to consider candidates outside Europe.** If you want to keep an eye out for job openings in other locations you can Connect with us.

**Our recruitment process**
---------------------------



* Submit your application and answer some basic questions. No cover letter or CV required
* Two short online assessments — for personality and logical ability — to help us be more objective and reduce biases ️


* A short interview with the hiring manager. That’s me, CJ
* Take home code assignment, where you’ll spend about 3 hours implementing a feature ‍


* Interview with two developers on the team, where you’ll discuss code you’ve written and how we work
* Offer to join the team, if we think we are a match for each-other
So what do you say? Do you want to help us paint the world pink? Then let’s talk!

title: Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core)
description:
**About Us**
 Sinch is a global leader in cloud communications, helping businesses connect with their customers on their mobile phones. We reach every phone on earth, with over 147 billion conversations every year. Our technology powers the world's leading communications platforms.
   

  

 We are a dynamic and innovative team seeking a passionate Backend Software Engineer (.NET Core) to collaborate on our cloud-based communication solutions that are built using the latest versions of C# and .NET Core hosted on AWS using cloud native technologies like Kubernetes and Docker.
   

  

 The working model is hybrid, and you can work from Stockholm or Malmo office.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Create systems that are not only scalable but also resilient, ensuring graceful failure.
* Manage the software lifecycle from design and development to testing and production deployment.
* Work with a range of different technologies and programming languages, but primarily with C# and .NET Core.
* Actively contribute to enhancing our development processes and pipelines.
* Take a hands-on approach to monitoring production environments, identifying issues, and being on-call when necessary.
* Engage closely with software engineers, architects, DevOps specialists, and product managers to deliver exceptional products.


**Requirements**
* Experienced professional in team-based development, deployment, and maintenance of software products in production.
* In-depth knowledge of .NET Core and a deep passion for technology.
* Strong written and verbal communication skills in English.
* Ability to work effectively within a cross-functional self-organizing team, fostering collaboration and mutual respect among team members.
* A passion for writing clean and testable code.
* Bachelor's degree in computer science or related technical discipline.


**Good to have**
* Experience in a similar industry or related one.
* Experience working with service-oriented architecture and distributed systems.
* Experience with Kubernetes or similar technologies.
* Experience working with AWS.
* Proven ability to work with others to solve tough technical problems.
* Ability to thrive in a dynamic and fast-paced work environment characteristic of agile development methodologies.
* Experience guiding and mentoring fellow developers empowering them to contribute effectively to team goals.


**Embrace the challenge and join us!**

title: Junior Software Engineer
description:
**Position Type**
 Full time
   

  

**Type Of Hire**
 Experienced (relevant combo of work and education)
   

  

**Education Desired**
 Bachelor of Computer Engineering
   

  

**Travel Percentage**
 0%
   

  

 FIS is a leading global provider of financial software that powers the world's economy. We are a diverse team of innovators who are passionate about creating cutting-edge fintech products and solutions for our clients and communities. We are committed to championing diversity and creating an inclusive workplace.
   

  

 The FIS Cross-Asset Trading and Risk solution helps firms quickly enter new markets and support new strategies. We deliver real-time controls for trading, order management, profit & loss and position keeping with risk management, all on one platform for both sell-side and buy-side.
   

  

**About The Role**
**As a developer in our Market Integration** 
 team you will be challenged with a wide range of tasks, ranging from design, development and maintenance of our solution. The Market Integration team is responsible for the integration solution to exchanges globally as well as integration to alternative trading platforms and broker networks. The solution is based on back-end modules with very demanding requirements on low latency as well as high throughput. We have a test-driven development process, and the development is done with in-house developed frameworks using UML, pre-processing and a C like mapping language in parallel with standard C++ and Python.
   

  

 We will offer you challenges, where understanding market and customer requirements and solving problems is a key part, in combination with creating advanced technical solutions. You will be part of an Agile Scrum team with skilled and motivated developers and QA that take full responsibility for its solution which includes both working on continuous improvements as well as innovations. By working closely together with Senior Developers and the Product Owner in your Scrum team you will get a deep understanding of market needs.
   

  

**Position Requirements**
 We expect you to have the following~
   

  

* M Sc. in Computer Science, Engineering Physics or similar degree.
* Experience in an object-oriented language like Python or C++ is a plus.
* A great interest in learning the financial markets.
* Have capacity to deliver high quality software in a high pace environment.
* Good skills in English.


**In Addition To This We Believe That You**
* Have knowledge about tools like Jira, GitHub, containerization tools.
* Like to take initiatives and influence the direction of your own development.
* Have strong analytical thinking with an attitude that problems are to be solved.
* Are communicative and strongly like to work in a team and share knowledge with others.
* Are not afraid of challenging your colleagues in their mindset.


**What We Offer You**
 At FIS, we offer you the opportunity to shape the future of fintech. You will be part of an expansive phase in our continued journey. We believe in creating a workplace where ideas can flow freely and where every day is different. A career at FIS is more than just a job. We offer~
   

  

* A flexible work-life where we embrace the mix of working digitally and from the office
* A broad range of professional education and personal development possibilities
* A work environment built on collaboration, flexibility and respect
* The chance to work on some of the most challenging, relevant issues in financial services and technology
* A voice in the future of one of the World's largest Fintech organizations


**Privacy Statement**
 FIS is committed to protecting the privacy and security of all personal information that we process in order to provide services to our clients. For specific information on how FIS protects personal information online, please see the Online Privacy Notice .
   

  

**Sourcing Model**
 Recruitment at FIS works primarily on a direct sourcing model; a relatively small portion of our hiring is through recruitment agencies. FIS does not accept resumes from recruitment agencies which are not on the preferred supplier list and is not responsible for any related fees for resumes submitted to job postings, our employees, or any other part of our company.
   

  

 #pridepass

title: Backend  Developer   Intern
description:
**XR Solutions** 
 is a technology based company that utilizes machine learning and powerful research-based optimizations to provide practical, reliable and optimizing augmented reality solutions to industrial companies.
 



 We believe that our AR technology can change working methods, the way of thinking and enable new innovative solutions that previously was not achievable in industry and machine operation.
 



  





**Role Overview:** 




 We are seeking a passionate and dedicated Backend Developer Intern to join our team for a 6-month unpaid internship. This is an exciting opportunity for someone looking to gain hands-on experience in backend development and DevOps within a fast-paced and supportive environment. As a Backend Developer Intern at XR Solutions, you will work closely with our developers.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Implementing APIs: Develop and maintain effective and performant APIs using Node.js and Express.js to support various applications and services.
* System Integrations: Assist in the design and implementation of system integrations, ensuring seamless communication between different software components.
* Testing: Build and execute unitand integration tests to ensure the reliability and efficiency of our systems.
* MBaaS Development: Contribute to our Mobile Backend as a Service (MBaaS) development, helping to create scalable backend services for mobile applications.
* Maintenance: Participate in the troubleshooting, debugging, and patching of existing software to maintain optimal performance and resolve issues promptly.
* Software Quality: Improve software quality by adhering to industry best practices.
* Code Reviews: Engage in code review sessions with other developers to ensure code quality, consistency, and adherence to best practices.
* IT Security: Contribute to maintaining and enhancing IT security protocols, ensuring that all systems are secure and compliant with industry standards.



  





**Required Skills:** 



* Proficiency in Node.js and Express.js for backend development.
* Strong knowledge of JavaScript and its application in server-side development.
* Experience with PostgreSQL for database management.
* Familiarity with AWS services and basic DevOps practices.
* Understanding of version control using Git (We use bitbucket).
* Basic knowledge of IT security principles.



  





**Tools & Technologies:** 



* Development Tools: Visual Studio Code (VSCode), Hoppscotch, pgAdmin.
* Cloud & DevOps: AWS (Amazon Web Services), CI/CD pipelines.
* Project Management: Jira for task management and collaboration.
* Communication: Slack for team communication and coordination.



  





**What You’ll Gain:** 



* Hands-on experience in backend development.
* Exposure to industry best practices in software development and IT security.
* Opportunity to work on real-world projects and contribute to innovative solutions.
* Valuable insights into working in a fast-paced, collaborative environment.
* Be part of a product launch



  





 If you’re excited about this opportunity and eager to learn, please send your resume outlining your interest in the position. We look forward to helping you grow your skills and advance your career in backend development.
 



  





**This is a unpaid internship initially**

title: Software Engineer - Early Careers
description:
**About The Role**
**Important note:** 
 Please remember to include your grade transcript along with your CV when submitting your application.
   

  

**The team:** 
 Our team consists of 8-10 engineers and is responsible for a web-based application for delivery of optimization services for large financial institutions. We value working with passionate, talented and nice people who have fun together while pushing ourselves and our systems to improve continuously. Our architecture is clean and modern and based upon patterns like automated testing, modulation, clear boundaries and clear responsibilities, and we believe in continuous and iterative delivery, fail fast, prototyping and continuous feedback from internal and external clients.
   

  

**The impact:** 
 OSTTRA has the largest financial institutions in the world as clients, and our optimization businesses are the largest banks in the world specifically. Our optimization services deliver significant impacts on clients' portfolio compositions and operational costs, and when we run our services, global metrics of systemic risks in the financial markets move to a high degree. We believe that long-term value to the client is the most important goal of our team, and technology is the tool to bring that value, and your contribution in the form of delivery, improvements and innovations can have a significant impact on the financial system.
   

  

**What’s In It For You**
 We strongly believe in individual growth and have long experience in guiding early careers engineers in our modern approach to software production, which includes:
   

  

* Rapid, iterative and phased delivery, backed by automated testing and deployment frameworks
* Streamlined, autonomous and independent teams, optimised and supported for fast change
* Clean architecture for maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with the team structures and with clear boundaries and responsibilities
* Innovative culture with a strong focus on exploration and prototyping, where failing fast is a virtue which drives technological and product improvements.


 We’ve worked with many students and hired several who joined originally during their studies - so this could be the place you activate your career.
   

  

**Early Career Software Engineer Position Profile**
 We are seeking a newly graduated student to join our innovative and forward-thinking team as a Software Engineer during the summer of 2024. Our company is at the forefront of rapid, iterative, and phased delivery, backed by cutting-edge automated testing and deployment frameworks. We believe in streamlined, autonomous, and independent teams that are optimised and supported for swift adaptability. Our commitment to clean architecture ensures maintainable, scalable, and flexible code, aligned with team structures and defined responsibilities.
   

  

**Role Overview**
 As a Software Engineer, you will contribute to the success of our projects with a
   

  

 focus on talent, passion, and grit. While no prior work experience is required, we are looking for candidates who hold a Master's degree in Computer Science. We foster an innovative culture that places a strong emphasis on exploration and prototyping. Here, failing fast is seen as a virtue, propelling technological and product improvements.
   

  

* Collaborate with cross-functional, autonomous teams for rapid and phased


 delivery
   

  

* Uphold clean architecture principles to ensure code maintainability, scalability,


 and flexibility
   

  

* Contribute to an innovative culture through exploration, prototyping, and a


 willingness to take calculated risks
   

  

* Engage in continuous learning to stay abreast of the latest technologies and


 industry best practices
   

  

**Basic Qualifications**
**What We're Looking For:**
* Master's degree in Computer Science
* Strong problem-solving skills and a passion for learning
* Demonstrated ability to work effectively in an autonomous and collaborative


 environment
   

  

* Excellent communication skills and the ability to contribute ideas to a diverse


 team
   

  

 If you are a tech enthusiast with a thirst for innovation and a desire to contribute to an exciting and fast-paced environment, we invite you to apply for this position. Join us as we redefine the boundaries of technology and drive impactful change in the industry.
   

  

**About OSTTRA**
*Candidates should note that OSTTRA is an independent firm, jointly owned by S&P Global and CME Group. As part of the joint venture, S&P Global provides recruitment services to OSTTRA - however, successful candidates will be interviewed and directly employed by OSTTRA, joining our global team of more than 1,200 post trade experts.*
 OSTTRA was formed in 2021 through the combination of four businesses that have been at the heart of post trade evolution and innovation for the last 20+ years: MarkitServ, Traiana, TriOptima and Reset. OSTTRA is a joint venture, owned 50/50 by S&P Global and CME Group.
   

  

 With an outstanding track record of developing and supporting critical market infrastructure, our combined network connects thousands of market participants to streamline end to end workflows - from trade capture at the point of execution, through portfolio optimization, to clearing and settlement.
   

  

 Joining the OSTTRA team is a unique opportunity to help build a bold new business with an outstanding heritage in financial technology, playing a central role in supporting global financial markets.
   

  

 Learn more at www.osttra.com.
   

  

**What’s In It For** 
**You?**
**Benefits**
 We take care of you, so you can take care of business. We care about our people. That’s why we provide everything you—and your career—need to thrive at S&P Global.
   

  

**Our Benefits Include**
* Health & Wellness: Health care coverage designed for the mind and body.
* Flexible Downtime: Generous time off helps keep you energized for your time on.
* Continuous Learning: Access a wealth of resources to grow your career and learn valuable new skills.
* Invest in Your Future: Secure your financial future through competitive pay, retirement planning, a continuing education program with a company-matched student loan contribution, and financial wellness programs.
* Family Friendly Perks: It’s not just about you. S&P Global has perks for your partners and little ones, too, with some best-in class benefits for families.
* Beyond the Basics: From retail discounts to referral incentive awards—small perks can make a big difference.


 For more information on benefits by country visit: https://spgbenefits.com/benefit-summaries
   

  

**Equal Opportunity Employer**
 S&P Global is an equal opportunity employer and all qualified candidates will receive consideration for employment without regard to race/ethnicity, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, disability, marital status, military veteran status, unemployment status, or any other status protected by law. Only electronic job submissions will be considered for employment.
   

  

 If you need an accommodation during the application process due to a disability, please send an email to: EEO.Compliance@spglobal.com and your request will be forwarded to the appropriate person.
   

  

**US Candidates Only:** 
 The EEO is the Law Poster http://www.dol.gov/ofccp/regs/compliance/posters/pdf/eeopost.pdf describes discrimination protections under federal law.
   

  

 20 - Professional (EEO-2 Job Categories-United States of America), BSMGMT203 - Entry Professional (EEO Job Group)
   

  

**Job ID:** 
 306449
   

  

**Posted On:** 
 2024-08-29
   

  

**Location:** 
 Stockholm, Sweden

title: Turnpikes söker utvecklare!
description:
Är du passionerad inom IT och söker nya utmaningar? Turnpikes erbjuder en dynamisk arbetsmiljö där du kan växa och utvecklas tillsammans med ett team av engagerade kollegor. Välkommen till ett företag i framkant av teknik och innovation!
 


  

  

  

  


  

**Företag :**
 Turnpikes Sweden Filial
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Enligt överenskommelse
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Rekrytering
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Turnpikes är en talangfull grupp människor med huvudkontor i Danmark men verksamma över hela världen, som möjliggör digital transformation för företagskunder. Turnpikes värdesätter sina starka relationer, strävar alltid efter att skapa värde och är stolta över sin extremt höga kundnöjdhet från några av världens största företag.
 


  


 Med en ständigt växande kundbas har behovet av ytterligare expansion blivit tydligt. Nu söker vi utvecklare som i en bred roll kommer få ta stort ansvar gentemot den svenska kundbasen. Du kommer att arbeta med tekniska uppgifter relaterade till OpenText Extended ECM (Enterprise Content Management) och leverera kvalitativa konfigurationer till projektteamet som definierar omfattningen och interagerar med slutkunden.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* En fot in på ett företag vars tillväxtstrategi är ambitiös och där du får utrymme att växa i karriären
  
* Tydliga utvecklingsplaner och en platt struktur som ger dig tillgång till en stor kunskapsbas
  
* Möjlighet att arbeta med banbrytande teknologi och branschledande lösningar
  
* Omfattande förmånspaket
  

  


**Arbetsuppgifter**
  
* Arbeta med definierade uppgifter i OpenText Extended ECM, som Web Reports, arbetsflöden, arkivhantering, etc.
  
* Leverera hög kvalitet i konfigurationer, utvecklingar och relaterad dokumentation.
  
* Samarbeta i ett större projektteam och kommunicera med dina kollegor på olika platser i världen.
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en relevant universitetsutbildning inom IT
  
* Har en god generell teknisk förståelse
  
* Har erfarenhet av mjukvaruutveckling
  
* Har grundläggande erfarenhet av databashantering
  
* Kan kommunicera väl på både svenska och engelska
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Stresstolerant
  
* Målmedveten
  
* Ansvarstagande
  
* Intellektuellt nyfiken
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Turnpikes Sweden Filial**

 Här kan du läsa mer om Turnpikes.
   




**Bli direktrekryterad till Turnpikes Sweden Filial**

 Detta är en direktrekrytering, vilket betyder att den kandidat som får tjänsten blir direktanställd av kundföretaget. Rekryteringsprocessen hanteras av Academic Work.
   




**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Mikaela Hofstedt eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på mikaela.hofstedt@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15105555

title: Business Developer
description:
**Join us and secure Scania's world-leading position - as our new business developer!** 

 ENT - Propulsion Development is in an intensive phase with several ongoing electrification projects that will ensure that Scania as well as cross brands within the TRATON group has world-leading powertrains solutions. 
 



 Do you want to join and help ENT - Propulsion Development to evaluate and improve our business processes and strategies? To meet this exciting future, we are now looking for a business developer! 
 



  
 


**Your work assigments** 

 As part of our team you will be a business process owner and will play a crucial role in shaping the future by collaborating closely with internal stakeholders as well as cross brands within the TRATON group. 
 



 As a business developer, you have a central role in the work within ENT to analyze, evaluate and improve our organization's processes and Way of working to ensure that the organization works smoothly and efficiently. 
 



 You have to be able to communicate changes and new strategies to management and employees within the organization so that the changes can be implemented well. 
 



  
 


**Your profile** 

 We believe that your expertise either in automotive industry or a background in leadership will be instrumental in analyzing needs, handle change activities and/or strategic deployment of initiatives. As an initiator and driver, your focus will be achieving impactful results and meeting deadlines. Experience in cross-functional collaboration and a university degree are beneficial.
 



 We particularly value that you have a personal drive, a desire to make a difference, a development-oriented approach and a good ability to work in a structured manner. 
 



 You are independent in your daily work, can engage yourself in details and have the ability to understand the whole, and work actively to achieve agreed goals. 
 



 Besides, you have good cooperation skills and like to create and maintain a big network of contacts. As information and communication is an essential part of the role, a good ability to express oneself verbally and in writing is required, both in Swedish and English. 
 



  
 


**We offer** 

 We offer an engaging and challenging role where innovation is encouraged. Our corporate culture values openness, diversity, and respect for the individual. We invest in our employees’ training and skill development to foster growth opportunities. 
 



 As a Scania employee, you’ll enjoy benefits such as employee car options, performance bonus, flexible working hours, subsidized lunch, and more. For those residing in Stockholm, we provide direct bus service between Stockholm and Södertälje with Scania Jobexpress.
 



  
 



 The business is in a positive development process! We are a committed team with various experiences that provide broad competence to the entire group. We are a happy and pleasant group looking for a new colleague. Do you want to join and become part of our team? Do not hesitate to apply - welcome with your application today.
 



  
 


**For more information** 

 Please contact Samir Rizvanovic, Head of ENTAP, 08-553 504 15
 



  
 


**Application** 

 Welcome to apply by answering some questions and by attaching your CV and any copies of relevant certificates. Selections will be made on an ongoing basis throughout the application period. 
 



 We use logic and personality tests in our selection process and a background check may be conducted for this position.

title: Software Engineer
description:
**We don’t just build technology. We build hope for everyone dealing with cancer.**
 Here at Elekta, you will make a difference. Our growing software development engineering team has opportunities in the development and testing of new and existing products. Our product teams thrive in a scaled, agile environment. Architects, product owners, designers and developers collaborate closely to rethink, reimagine, and create software that is simple, elegant, and easy to use. We want to make sure that physicians spend their time fighting cancer, not software.
   

  

**What You’ll Do At Elekta**
 As a Software Engineer for the control systems teams, you will apply software design theories and principles to design and develop new or existing products in the control system of the Leksell Gamma Knife. The control system is a complex and integrated system that controls multiple axis in the machine to safely deliver radiation to the patient. The CS SW also includes a service application, and it provides the interface to the Treatment Planning Software. You will be contributing to all phases of the product creation and maintenance process including requirements, design, implementation, and testing. Additionally, you will work with tools and processes required for the operation, maintenance, and testing of the products.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
* Perform evaluations of technologies, methodologies and products
* Software implementations, primarily in C++ including unit integration and test
* Follow technical and clinical evolution within the field
* Actively contribute to developing the control system software team by suggesting process improvements, sharing knowledge, and taking responsibility for software code and design improvements
* Participating in requirements engineering and product risk management
* Ensure that software designs are safe and comply with all applicable regulatory standards


**What You Bring**
* Master of Science in Computer Science, Mechatronics, Engineering Physics or equivalent
* Excellent in English in speech and writing
* C++ programming
* Windows OS
* Familiarity with coding for Safety applications.
* Familiarity with implementing comms protocols such as USB, CAN, Ethernet and SPI/I2C
* Development of test frameworks and simulators (Python)
* Strong communication skills
* Couple years of work experience from development of embedded SW


**Hiring process**
 We are looking forward to hearing from you! Apply by submitting your application and resumé in English, via the “Apply” button. Please note that we do not accept applications by e-mail.
   

  

**Your Elekta contact**
 For questions, please contact the Global Talent Acquisition Partner responsible, Nidhi Sarkar at nidhi.sakar@elekta.com.
   

  

**We are an equal opportunity employer.**
 We evaluate qualified applicants without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, genetic information, national origin, disability, veteran status, or any other status protected by law in the locations where Elekta operates.

title: Developer - Backend
description:
*Research shows that women and other under-represented groups within our industry hesitate to apply unless they tick most boxes of a role description. At H2 Green Steel, we are building an impact company with sustainability at its core. We need a diverse, inclusive, and authentic team to rally behind our purpose of de-carbonizing hard-to-abate industries, starting with steel.*
*So, i* 
*f you are equally passionate about our purpose yet concerned that your experience doesn* 
*’* 
*t* 
*perfectly* 
*align with the qualifications stated in the job advert, we strongly encourage you to apply anyway. You may be just the right candidate, either for this role – or for another upcoming role in our* 
*rapidly* 
*growing* 
*business* 
*.*
**About us:**
 H2 Green Steel is on a mission to disrupt the global steel industry by producing green steel, with the end goal of bringing down CO2 emissions to zero. By using green hydrogen and fossil-free electricity instead of coal; water and heat will be our primary emissions. By 2030, our ambition is to produce 5 million tonnes of green steel annually in our fully integrated, digitalized, and sustainable plant in Boden, located in northern Sweden - currently in construction phase. But this is just the beginning – our expertise in green hydrogen will enable us to decarbonize other industries in addition to steel, and we look forward to what’s next in store for us.
   

  

**Developer - Backend**
 At H2GS Digital we believe in business truthfulness and accordingly work in business aligned cross functional teams. Our teams work with operations
 *and* 
 development over the whole digital technology stack: integrations, operations, analytical data and front end. We want you and your teammates to grow outside your respective areas of expertise to solve business’ challenges as they occur.
   

  

 We are looking for a Backend Developer who is a passionate believer in microservice principles and wants to build a truly digital organization. You will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our microservice infrastructure, with a focus on enabling tailored solutions and integrations as required by our business. You will work closely with domain experts to understand their ways of working and build solutions that meet those needs. You will also be responsible for developing and maintaining our DevSecOps procedures and governance policies.
   

  

 This position is based in Stockholm and is part of H2 Green Steel’s Digital Team.
   

  

 Applications will be reviewed from 5th of August.
   

  

**About Seniority**
 We are actively seeking developers with varying levels of expertise, ranging from recent university graduates to seasoned professionals. The level of seniority you bring will correspond to the qualifications and experiences outlined below, with more senior candidates expected to possess a broader spectrum of these attributes.
   

  

**Some soft qualities we value.**
* You are curious about new things, but always balancing new ideas towards existing wisdom.
* You appreciate diverse viewpoints when tackling challenges yet understands the significance of reaching a consensus and adhering to the established pattern for effective collaboration.
* You are passionate about what you are doing and have a genuine interest in delivering great solutions.
* You embody a service-oriented mindset, making yourself accessible to your business colleagues. Recognizing that value is substantiated when business needs are met.
* You communicate effortlessly both verbally and in writing with colleagues and external parties within completely different domains/areas of expertise.
* You possess the ability to analyze and break down a bigger problem into smaller, graspable parts.
* You appreciate the importance of understanding and connecting with the organization's mission, goals, and strategies.


**Qualifications We Look For**
* An academic degree in computer science, data science or a related field, or equivalent practical experience


**Tech knowledge** 
**and experience we appreciate**
* Development experience from event driven microservice environments using RESTful APIs
* Kotlin and Spring Boot in containerized environments
* Message-broker platforms like RabbitMQ or similar.
* Automated software building, testing and deployment using GitLab CI/CD
* Infrastructure as Code using Terraform
* Hands on experience working with Kubernetes clusters or similar
* Hands on experience working with AWS S3, Snowflake and dbt or similar
* Professional experience with IIoT environments and protocols like OPC UA and PROFINET


 In our agile environment, every team requires a dedicated agile servant to unlock its full potential. If you're passionate about fostering team efficiency and collaboration, you may also be an ideal scrum master.
   

  

**What We Can Offer You**
* The opportunity to work on cutting-edge technology
* A chance to make a real impact on the world
* A collaborative and supportive work environment


 If you're fueled by passion and eager to thrive in a diverse range of domains seamlessly connected by a dynamic microservice environment, we invite you to apply and be part of the excitement!
   

  

 You will get the opportunity to shape your future career together with a company focusing on creating a culture where everyone can thrive and feel a sense of belonging. In the end, we know that H2 Green Steel’s growth and success is dependent on our people and we can’t wait to shape the future of steelmaking and other industries together as a team.

title: Software Engineer to Life Science start-up
description:
Here you have the opportunity to be part of something special! We're on the lookout for a Software Engineer to join our partner and their passionate team of experts. If you're enthusiastic about breaking new ground and immersing yourself in cutting-edge technology within the research field, this is the opportunity you've been longing for. Seize the chance to be part of something extraordinary!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 Technology
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time, office hours
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Our partner has rapidly expanded their business, achieving remarkable success in the field of Life Sciences. Picture yourself contributing to the development of a groundbreaking Life Science product that is set to redefine the industry. The start-up is a passionate organisation of approximately 50 individuals that work together in the development-phase with the mission to launch a cutting-edge Life Science product.
 


  


 You will be part of a dedicated team composed of four experienced and talanted Software Engineers. Together you will collaborate in the early software development setting up the architecture and designing the the software related to the product and its hardware.
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* A part of an organisation destined for greatness
  
* Projects focused on new technologies and products
  
* A dedicated Consultant Manager that cares about your personal och professional development
  

  


**Work tasks**
  
* Designing and developing software, including hardware control and analysis SW
  
* Participate in code reviews, create unit tests, and engage in various activities to ensure the development of high-quality software
  
* Planning and executing software development projects
  
* Work actively in the code base with Python
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* A candidate with a MsC in Software Engineering, Information Technology, Computer Science or similar
  
* Work life experience of working with product development and embedded systems
  
* Up-to-date programming skills in Python within Linux environment
  
* Fluent in English both in writing and verbally since it is the language used with colleagues and customers
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Experience of working with product development within the Life Science industry
  
* Skills in DevOps and setting up CI/CD pipelines
  
* Fluent in Swedish both in writing and verbally
  


  


  

**To succeed in the role, your personal skills are:**



  


 You are communicative and collaborative, and you enjoy working in a goal-oriented environment and on projects with cross-functional teams. You have a proactive, entrepreneurial mindset and have a sense of urgency and have the tools to create and maintain a culture of innovation and excellence. It is important that you have strong teamwork skills and an analytical and pragmatic approach. You are friendly, positive, and fun to work with, and you enjoy working in a fast-paced, changing environment.
 


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Erik Gund or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth4@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106278

title: Site Engineer
description:
**Site/Full-Stack Engineer** 




**Wallism** 
 is a company that leverages technology to scale, automate, and innovate our industry. We take software engineering seriously and have a small, dedicated team of engineers with an appetite for innovative software solutions. Our ideal candidate has extensive experience in developing and maintaining high-traffic websites that demand an exceptional user experience.
 



  





**Wallism.com** 
 is rapidly emerging as the industry-leading platform, delivering custom-made wallpaper murals to over 20 markets while consistently maintaining a top-rated TrustPilot score. Despite our fast-paced growth, we are committed to keeping our product team small, collaborative, and highly efficient. Each team member plays a critical role, bringing essential skills, experience, and dedication to significantly impact our product and the evolution of our software solutions.
 



 Our team consists of senior professionals who are self-sufficient and enjoy a high level of autonomy in how, where, and when they work. Our studio, located in the heart of Stockholm, serves as a space where we come together to achieve our goals.
 



  





**Objectives of this Role** 




  




* Elevate our site platform to the next level by developing cutting-edge caching mechanisms, enhancing existing UI modules, and optimizing performance in areas such as speed, search, and user engagement.
* Plan, shape, and execute projects focused on the main site and the surrounding software systems.
* Play a key role in the formation of new projects by contributing innovative ideas and technical expertise.
* Ensure smooth project initiation through active collaboration with people across the company.
* Visualize and design new features to enhance the customer experience.



  





**Required Skills and Qualifications** 




  




* Five or more years of experience as a web developer / site engineer
* Expertise in TypeScript, HTML, and CSS
* Two or more years of experience with any of the major web frameworks for developing web applications (e.g., React, Svelte, Vue, Angular)
* Extensive experience working with APIs
* Proficiency with content management systems
* Proven ability to document design processes, including development, testing, analytics, and troubleshooting



  





**Preferred Skills and Qualifications** 




  




* Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in software engineering or information technology
* Experience working with micro frontends and server-side rendering
* Strong understanding of client-server architecture



  





 We are interviewing applicants on a rolling basis and will fill the role once we find the perfect match. If you believe you’re the right fit, we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

title: Senior Engineering Manager
description:
**Ready to inspire change?**
 Do you step forward when opportunity arises? What can you see that others don’t, in those around you? We’re on the lookout for inspirational managers who want to bring out the best in their people. If you can inspire a team and guide people towards growth, this is your chance. The world of mobility is changing. Come and make your mark.
   

  

 What’s in it for you?
   

  

 This role is within our Commercial Digital team, which is using digital technologies to reinvent the experience of becoming a Volvo customer. There’s no reason the experience of buying a car should be painful and difficult – it should be as enjoyable and exciting as actually having a new car. That is our mission. You will be responsible for developing software for consumer facing and internal products across more than 100 countries accessed by millions of people. We create the end-to-end experience for online sales/subscriptions of cars, global campaigns as well as frameworks for other parts of Volvo cars. Your responsibilities will include rapid development of prototypes/concepts, and regular product development.
   

  

 You should have start-up mind set where you have quickly developed prototypes and catalysed product development in a fast paced, fluid environment. You have or have recently had hands-on development experience. You are experienced with agile development and a champion of software development best practices. The team is primarily located in Gothenburg, Stockholm Sweden, and we also have teams in the San Francisco US and in Shanghai China. Many of the people you will be working with have experience from start-ups and global tech companies such as Spotify, Google, Ericsson, Microsoft, Tradera, Klarna, EA Games etc.
   

  

**You And Your Skills**
 We are looking for an experienced software engineering manager who has previously built and led software engineering teams.
   

  

 In this role, you'll split your time between hands-on development or technical design within a team and managing a development team. As a manager, you'll be responsible for hiring, compensation, and employee career development.
   

  

 You likely have a degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related technical field—or equivalent practical experience. You're passionate about transforming and developing digital products, architecture, and best practices. You enjoy interacting with development teams to understand their needs and product missions. With servant leadership and a strong technical foundation, you strive to create a fast and fun developer experience. Strong people management, collaboration, and communication skills are essential in this role.
   

  

 Together with the other digital leaders within Commercial Digital, you will
   

  

* Build and nurture teams of highly talented engineers.
* Guide and support individual engineers and teams, removing obstacles to deliver software efficiently at scale.
* Spearhead technology strategy in your domain, working closely with the product manager to align architecture and strategy with the product vision.
* Promote collaboration, diversity, and team engagement.
* Advocate for and implement modern software development, operational, and engineering practices.
* Actively seek opportunities to learn and enhance our products and processes.
* Contribute hands-on to developing our solutions, using technologies like TypeScript, JavaScript, C#, and React, with deployments on Azure and AWS.


 We offer our employees excellent benefits such as:
   

  

* Plenty of leave to let you take time off for what’s most important in life.
* Collective Agreement and ITP pensions.
* An annual allowance to be spent on your health and wellbeing.


 Volvo Cars - Driving change together
   

  

 Volvo Cars’ success is the result of a collaborative, diverse, and inclusive working environment. Today, we are one of the most well-known and respected car brands, with around 43,000 employees across the globe. At Volvo Cars, your career is designed around your skills and aspirations, allowing you to reach your fullest potential.
   

  

 By 2025, we aim to sell 1.2 million cars annually, with 50 per cent being electric cars and sold directly to customers mainly through digital channels. Join us on this exciting journey as we pioneer the driving and electrification technologies of the future.
   

  

 Curious about Life at Volvo Cars? Read more here
   

  

 Curious about our story? Read more here

title: Applikationsutvecklare inom C#.NET!
description:
Vi söker en driven konsult för att stärka vår kunds team av applikationsutvecklare. Du kommer att vara en viktig av utvecklingsteamet som skapar och underhåller applikationer i C#, med deployment i Azure-miljö. Rollen innebär att du arbetar enligt DevOps-principer, vilket betyder att du följer dina ändringar hela vägen från utveckling till produktionssättning.
 



  

**Företag :**
 X5 Group AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Stockholm
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
 



  

**Övrigt :**
 Möjlighet till distansarbete
   




**Om tjänsten**

 X5 Music Group, ett dotterbolag till Warner Music Group, är ett musikföretag baserat i Stockholm, Sverige, specialiserat på marknaden för musikstreaming. Som .NET Utvecklare kommer du att arbeta med varierande arbetsuppgifter och successivt ta dig an mer ansvar inom programmering.
 


  


  

**Du erbjuds**



  

  
* Möjligheten att få ingå i ett härligt team med kompetenta medarbetare som har arbetat i rollen i flertalet år
  
* En arbetsgivare som ligger i framkant och ständigt arbetar med den senaste tekniken
  
* En spännande roll med utvecklingsmöjligheter där du successivt får ta dig an nya utmaningar och ansvarsområden
  

  


**Vi söker dig som**
  
* **Stark kunskap och minst 2 års erfarenhet av utveckling i C#.**
  
* Erfarenhet av deployment och hantering av applikationer i Azure.
  
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med Azure-servicar.
  
* Kompetens inom Docker och containerhantering.
  
* Kunskap i SQL och databashantering.
  
* Är flytande i det svenska språket, skriftligt och muntligt, då språket används dagligen.
  


  


  

**Personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Självgående och ansvarstagande.
  
* God problemlösningsförmåga.
  
* Stark samarbetsförmåga och vana att arbeta i team.
  
* Förmåga att hantera flera uppgifter samtidigt och prioritera effektivt.
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Fanny Steisjö eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på stv2@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106724

title: Senior Web Developer, Jigsaw (Remote) - $60,000/year USD
description:
Crossover is the world's #1 source of full-time remote jobs. Our clients offer top-tier pay for top-tier talent. We're recruiting this role for our client, Jigsaw. Have you got what it takes?
   

  

 Jigsaw is searching for a PHP expert who thrives in fast-paced environments and is eager to drive technological advancements in the software industry. This role is ideal for someone who excels in PHP development and is passionate about leading teams towards innovation.
   

  

 The software industry often suffers from the slow pace of adopting new technologies and methodologies. At Jigsaw, we distinguish ourselves by rapidly embracing and implementing the latest cloud and PHP technologies. As our subject matter expert, you will be a catalyst in accelerating this shift, moving away from conventional development processes to more agile, efficient practices.
   

  

 Your role will involve leading the development and delivery of cutting-edge PHP solutions both in front-end and back-end services. Your expertise in PHP development will not only contribute to the creation of advanced software solutions, but also drive the strategic direction of our product offerings. You'll play a pivotal role in ensuring our solutions align with client needs and industry trends.
   

  

 Joining Jigsaw means becoming part of a dynamic, forward-thinking company where innovative ideas are valued and professional growth is encouraged. If you're ready to join us in transforming the software domain, apply now!
   

  

**What You Will Be Doing**
* Spearheading the development of customer-facing UIs and back-end services using PHP, ensuring scalable and efficient solutions
* Taking ownership of end-to-end project delivery, working closely with cross-functional Agile teams
* Guiding and mentoring a talented engineering team, promoting the use of best practices and fostering a culture of technical excellence


**Basic Requirements**
**Senior Web Developer key responsibilities**
* Must be based in the European Union, United Kingdom, or EEA
* At least 4 years of professional experience in PHP development
* Familiarity with front-end technologies (HTML5, JavaScript, CSS3) and MySQL
* The ability to integrate applications with third-party services using REST APIs with formats like JSON and XML


**About Jigsaw**
 Delivered on a software-as-a-service (SaaS) platform, Jigsaw’s virtual learning and collaboration technology enables our customers to revolutionize how they train, educate, collaborate and work through a virtual environment – helping them embrace digital transformation and enhance their organizations’ success.
   

  

 There is so much to cover for this exciting role, and space here is limited. Hit the Apply button if you found this interesting and want to learn more. We look forward to meeting you!
   

  

**Working with Crossover**
 This is a full-time (40 hours per week), long-term position. The position is immediately available and requires entering into an independent contractor agreement with Crossover. The compensation level for this role is $30 USD/hour, which equates to $60,000 USD/year assuming 40 hours per week and 50 weeks per year. The payment period is weekly. Consult www.crossover.com/help-and-faqs for more details on this topic.
   

  

**What to expect next:**
* You will receive an email with a link to start your self-paced, online job application.
* Our hiring platform will guide you through a series of online “screening” assessments to check for basic job fit, job-related skills, and finally a few real-world job-specific assignments.


**Important!** 
 If you do not receive an email from us:
   

  

* First, emails may take up to 15 minutes to send, refresh and check again.
* Second, check your spam and junk folders for an email from Crossover.com, mark as “Not Spam” since you will receive other emails as well.
* Third, we will send to whatever email account you indicated on the Apply form - by default, that is the email address you use as your LinkedIn username and it might be different than the one you have already checked.
* If all else fails, just reset your password by visiting https://www.crossover.com/auth/password-recovery if you already applied using LinkedIn EasyApply.


 Crossover Job Code: LJ-5169-SE-Stockhol-SeniorWebDevel.001

title: Senior Full Stack developer
description:
Barnebys Group AB is the world’s leading eco-system for art, antiques and collectibles throughout the value chain. Founded in Stockholm, Sweden in 2011, we have established our business globally with offices in the US, UK, France, Spain and Germany. Our clients include the world’s top tier of auctioneers, antique dealers, galleries as well as regional and local businesses. We offer a search service with 600,000+ items for sale, an extensive database of auction results, a top of the line valuation service, and a white label auction and gallery system. We are now looking to grow our business even further and are seeking top talent to join our team.
 



  





 We’re looking for a Senior Full Stack Developer to join our team based in Stockholm. As a part of the Skeleton team you would be working on building our White Label Auction System that enables our customers to run auctions and stores with world class user experience and performance.
 



 Skeleton is built with the goal to be the best solution for auction houses, galleries and dealers in the world and you will play a crucial part in that journey.
 



  





 The Skeleton system is built both using .NET/C# and ReactJS, Node and NextJS for various parts of the solution.
 



  





 We believe in constant improvements and sound developer practices.
 



  





**What You’ll Do:** 



* Team Success: Play a key role in planning, designing, and building scalable backend solutions while understanding the full stack.
* Quality Coding: Write and review clean, testable, and scalable code, ensuring continuous improvement.
* Collaborate: Work closely with product owners, business teams, and developers to deliver valuable solutions.
* Optimise: Participate in the full development lifecycle, focusing on performance and reliability.
* Grow with Us: If you’re dedicated, there are opportunities for personal and professional growth within the company



  





**Who You Are:** 



* Experienced Developer: 6-7 years in scalable, distributed systems with a focus on C# and .NET, and experience with Azure.
* Fullstack with Backend Focus: Strong backend skills with an understanding of frontend integration.
* Pragmatic: You deliver value without getting lost in details.
* Team Player: Strong communicator, mentor, and collaborator.
* Business-Oriented: You balance technical decisions with business goals.



  





**We Offer:** 



* A supportive environment with growth opportunities.
* The latest technology and a role in shaping our future.
* A team that values collaboration, innovation, and quality.



  





 We are proud of our culture, as it is a huge part of what makes us successful. We are an equal opportunity employer and celebrate diversity, recognizing that diversity of thought and background builds stronger teams. We approach diversity and inclusion seriously and thoughtfully.
