title: Data Architect
description:
**Hej, Truecaller is calling you from Stockholm, Sweden! Ready to pick up?** 




  





 Our goal is to make communication smarter, safer, and more efficient, all while building trust everywhere. We're all about bringing you smart services with a big social impact, keeping you safe from fraud, harassment, scam calls, or messages, so you can focus on the conversations that matter.
 



  




* Top 20 most downloaded apps globally, and world’s #1 caller ID and spam-blocking service for Android and iOS, with extensive AI capabilities, with more than
 **400 million** 
 active users per month.
* Founded in 2009 with an impressive year-on-year growth
 
 with
 
 high profitability, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm, Large Cap.
* Founded in 2009, listed on Nasdaq OMX Stockholm and is categorized as a Large Cap. Our focus on innovation, operational excellence, sustainable growth, and collaboration has resulted in consistently high profitability and strong EBITDA margins.
* A team of 400 people from ~35 different nationalities spread across our headquarters in Stockholm and offices in Bangalore, Mumbai, Gurgaon, and Tel Aviv
 **with high ambitions** 
 .



  





**We at the Infrastructure team,** 
 work on a vision to empower our product-oriented teams with a complete self-service analytics platform to make data-driven decisions possible in Truecaller, guaranteeing the stability, velocity, and delivery of the mainstream events pipeline.
 



  





**As a Data Architect** 
 within
 **the infrastructure team,** 
 you will play a pivotal role in ensuring that our data architecture is scalable, efficient, and aligned with both the data platform's needs and the broader objectives of our business units. You will collaborate closely with various teams to design and optimize our data infrastructure, ensuring that it meets current and future demands.
 



  





**The impact you will create:** 



* Lead the design, development, and implementation of scalable data architecture solutions that align with Truecaller’s business goals, with an expectation to actively engage in hands-on work throughout the process.
* Work closely with the Data Infrastructure team to re-design and optimize the data infrastructure, ensuring high availability, reliability, and performance.
* Provide architectural guidance on data storage solutions, including databases, data lakes, and cloud-based systems.
* Collaborate with various business units to understand their data needs and translate these requirements into robust data solutions.
* Ensure the architecture supports cross-functional data initiatives and helps business units leverage data effectively for decision-making.
* Stay updated on emerging trends and technologies in data architecture, data engineering, and cloud platforms.
* Provide mentorship and technical guidance to data engineers within the centralized engineering team and across business units.
* Drive continuous improvement initiatives to enhance data processing efficiency and scalability.
* Create and maintain comprehensive documentation for data architecture, including diagrams, standards, and best practices.
* Ensure that data architecture aligns with industry standards and complies with regulatory requirements, particularly regarding data privacy and security.



  





**What you bring in:** 




* Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
* 15+ years of experience in data architecture, data engineering, or a related role.
* Proven experience in designing and implementing scalable data architecture in a large-scale environment.
* Hands-on experience with cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud.
* Strong proficiency in data modeling, ETL processes, and data warehousing solutions.
* Expertise in database technologies (SQL, NoSQL) and big data technologies (Hadoop, Spark).
* Familiarity with data governance and data security practices.
* Experience with programming languages such as Python or Scala.
* Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively across teams.
* Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle complex data challenges.
* **Ability to balance long-term strategic thinking with short-term execution.**



  





**It would be great if you also have:** 



* Knowledge of DevOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines, infrastructure as code, and automation of data infrastructure deployments.
* Understanding of how to architect data solutions that support machine learning pipelines and AI applications.



  





**Life at Truecaller -** 
 Behind the code:
 **https://www.instagram.com/lifeattruecaller/**




  





**Sounds like your dream job?** 




  





 We will fill the position as soon as we find the right candidate, so please send your application as soon as possible. As part of the recruitment process, we will conduct a background check.
 



  





**This position is based in Stockholm, Sweden.** 




  





 We only accept applications
 **in English** 
 .
 



  





**What we offer:** 



* **A smart, talented, and agile team:** 
 An international team where ~35 nationalities are working together in several locations and time zones with a learning, sharing, and fun environment.
* **A great compensation package:** 
 Competitive salary, 30 days of paid vacation, flexible working hours, private health insurance, parental leave top-up, pension contribution, Udemy membership to keep learning and improving, and free gym membership.
* **Great tech tools:** 
 Pick the computer and phone you most fancy within our budget ranges.
* **Do it your way** 
 : We work in the office on Tuesdays, Wednesdays, and Thursdays with flexibility on the other days.
* **Office life:** 
 Enjoy your days with a wide range of yummy snacks and beverages, and have fun in our playroom! As well as in our exciting company parties and team activities such as Lab days, Running team, and Geek lunch!



  





**Come as you are:** 




 Truecaller is diverse, equal, and inclusive. We need a variety of backgrounds, perspectives, beliefs, and experiences to keep building our great products. No matter where you are based, which language you speak, your accent, race, religion, color, nationality, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, etc.
 **All those things make you who you are, and that’s why we would love to meet you**

title: AI Consultant
description:
**About Us** 
 :
 



 Studio Stén is a generative AI studio that helps companies understand, implement and manage generative AI to optimize workflows, innovation and marketing. We inspire companies and individuals to utilize generative AI by sharing our knowledge through lectures, keynote speeches and courses. We build AI strategies, custom AI solutions, and create AI generated content. We approach everything with curiosity & exploration, and aim to creatively solve problems through generative AI for our clients.
 



  





 We always choose scalability over expansion, and this is a unique opportunity to join our team of two co-founders and a staff of AI-assistants. We’re looking for someone curious, adaptable, and eager to explore the dynamic world of generative AI. If you’re comfortable in the spotlight and eager to educate others about the possibilities of AI, we’d love to hear from you!
 



  





**The Role** 
 :
 



 We’re looking for an AI Consultant who shares our passion for generative AI and our commitment to excellence.
 



  





**What You’ll Do** 
 :
 



  




* Share your expertise by delivering lectures, workshops, and keynote speeches on generative AI.
* Keep pace with the latest AI advancements, continuously learning and adapting to new technologies.
* Work closely with our team to strategize, design, and implement AI workflows and solutions.
* Communicate and collaborate with clients to understand their needs and deliver custom AI solutions that make a real impact.



  





**What We’re Looking For** 
 :
 



  




* **Curiosity & Adaptability** 
 : We value a mindset of lifelong learning over traditional experience. If you’re eager to learn and grow, you’ll fit right in.
* **Cultural Fit** 
 : Our values are non-negotiable. We’re looking for someone who resonates with our philosophy of working smart, prioritizing quality, and valuing relationships.
* **Technical Understanding** 
 : While deep expertise in AI is a plus, it’s not a must. We’re more interested in your ability to think critically and learn quickly.
* **Presentation Skills** 
 : You should be comfortable speaking in front of an audience, simplifying complex concepts, and engaging others in the world of generative AI.
* **Collaboration & Independence:** 
 While you’ll be an integral part of our small team, we’re looking for someone who is equally comfortable working independently. You should be able to take ownership of projects, manage client relationships, and present confidently on your own. Your ability to navigate both teamwork and independent responsibilities will be key to your success in this role.



  





**What We Offer** 
 :
 


* **Supportive Environment** 
 : You’ll have the freedom to explore new ideas, the support to turn them into reality, and the flexibility to work in a way that suits you.
* **Work-Life Integration** 
 : We don’t count hours; we count results. Work efficiently, deliver high-quality work, and take the time you need to recharge.
* **Growth Opportunities** 
 : As part of a growing company, you’ll have the opportunity to shape your role, take on new challenges, and advance your career in a way that aligns with your personal goals.
* **Live as We Learn** 
 : We live as we learn, meaning we use AI in everything we do—from our daily tasks to our strategic decisions. We’re excited to hear how you use AI today.



 ﻿
 



 This job can be combined with other commitments.
 



  





**How to Apply** 
 :
 



 We don’t need a traditional cover letter. Instead, tell us a story about a time you used generative AI in a project or solved a problem in a creative way. Share what you learned and how it made an impact. Send us your resume and this story to hej@studiosten.se, and let’s start a conversation.

title: Systemadministratör till Vattenfall
description:
Har du en avslutad gymnasieutbildning samt erfarenhet av redovisnings- och controlling-processer? Har du även mycket goda kunskaper i SAP? Behörighetsexpert till Vattenfall, Solna. Ett perfekt jobb för dig som har erfarenhet sedan tidigare och är redo för nästa utmaning! Skicka in din ansökan redan idag då vi arbetar med löpande urval!
 



  

**Företag :**
 Vattenfall Business Services Nordic AB
 



  

**Plats :**
 Solna
 



  

**Jobbkategori :**
 IT
 



  

**Omfattning :**
 Heltid
 



  

**Startdatum :**
 Omgående
 



  

**Typ av uppdrag :**
 Konsultuppdrag
   




**Om tjänsten**

 Vattenfall söker nu en konsult för rollen som
   

**Application Expert**
 –
   

**Authorisations**
 i det internationella Authorization & Compliance-teamet, inom Financial Systems, inom Finance Business Support (FBS). Du kommer att vara en av ca 12 personer i teamet och rapportera till chefen för Authorization & Compliance.
   

 Applikationsexperten för behörigheter hjälper till att uppnå målen för Authorization & Compliance-teamet och fungerar som ambassadör för Finance Systems mission och strategi.
 


  


 Behörighet och Compliance arbetar för ett effektivt behörighets- och behörighetsstöd med relevanta verktyg och stödjer compliance-aktiviteter främst inom SAP ERP-området, med stöd av Vattenfalls IAM-system (identity management). Vi strävar efter en harmoniserad leverans i alla regioner och ett starkt gränsöverskridande samarbete.
 


  


  

**Dina huvudsakliga arbetsuppgifter och ansvarsområden:**



  

  
* Arbeta med behörighets-/myndighetsadministrativa uppgifter över regiongränserna för Vattenfall, partners och andra intressenter. Det handlar om att stödja organisationen och hantera ärenden om åtkomstförfrågningar och felsök i system som omfattas av t.ex. IAM (Vattenfalls Identity management system), SAP (ERP Classic och S4), SRM etc
  
* Agera gränssnitt/SPOC mot affärsområden, IT, övriga stabsfunktioner och outsourcingleverantör och därigenom bidra till goda relationer och god service gentemot intressenter och kunder
  
* Stöd med övervakning och uppföljning av revisionsresultat, risk och regelefterlevnad inom ramen för teamet och FBS.
  
* Samarbeta med riskägare för att minska risken, främst i det finansiella omfånget, till exempel genom att hantera SoD-risker (Segregation of Duty) och andra kritiska åtkomster
  
* Stöd vid verksamhetsförändringar, t.ex. etablering av nya företag, avveckling av företag, fusioner etc
  
* Delta i utvecklingsprojekt inom FBS eller koncernövergripande/tvärvetenskapliga projekt och driva uppdrag självständigt
  
* Stödja arbetet mot harmoniserade och standardiserade auktorisationskoncept och processer genom projekt och förbättringar. Ge processförbättringsidéer till processexperter/processspecialister. Sträva efter att automatisera repetitiva och lågvärdeskapande aktiviteter
  
* Stöd i att definiera/beskriva krav/behov inom området behörighetshantering, felsökning och utveckling, implementering och test av ändringsbegäran
  
* Stöd med framtagning av underlag för processer och verktyg för teamet, FBS och andra kunder och intressenter inom Vattenfall.
  
* Utföra tjänster med hög kvalitet och punktlighet i leveransen enligt gemensamma processer, policyer och riktlinjer
  


  


 Vissa resor kommer att krävas i arbetet.
   




**Vi söker dig som**
  
* Har en avslutad svensk gymnasial utbildning
  
* 2-4 års erfarenhet av att arbeta med SAP
  
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med behörigheter och identifiera ledningssystem
  
* Erfarenhet av att arbeta med affärssystem
  
* Erfarenhet eller kunskap om finansiella processer
  
* Erfarenhet från processutvecklingsarbete och projektarbete
  
* Flytande svenska och engelska (både muntligt och skriftligt)
  


  


  

**Det är meriterande om du har**



  

  
* Relevant universitetsexamen (t.ex. i företagsekonomi, redovisning, controlling) eller jämförbar annan utbildning
  


  


  

**För att lyckas i rollen har du följande personliga egenskaper:**



  

  
* Förmåga att ta ägarskap och visa engagemang samt att kunna arbeta självständigt
  
* Förmåga att arbeta i ett team och att arbeta proaktivt och lösningsorienterat
  
* Förmåga att arbeta i stora och komplexa organisationer och att hantera interna och externa gränssnitt effektivt
  


  

  

**Vår rekryteringsprocess**
  


 Denna rekryteringsprocess hanteras av Academic Work och vår kunds önskemål är att alla frågor rörande tjänsten skickas till Academic Work.
 


  


 Vi tillämpar löpande urval och kommer plocka ner annonsen när tillräckligt många kandidater har nått slutskedet i rekryteringsprocessen. Rekryteringsprocessen innehåller två urvalstest: ett personlighetstest och ett test i kognitiv förmåga. Testerna är ett verktyg för att kunna hitta den kandidat med högst potential för tjänsten samt främja jämlikhet, mångfald och en rättvis rekryteringsprocess.
   




**Bli en del av Academic Work**

 Som konsult för Academic Work erbjuds du stora möjligheter att växa professionellt och knyta värdefulla kontakter för framtiden. Du får en konsultchef som stöttar dig under resans gång och får ta del av olika förmåner, bl.a. möjlighet till kompetensutveckling i form av en grundläggande hållbarhetsutbildning.
 


 Läs mer om vårt konsulterbjudande här
   

**Har du frågor om tjänsten?**

 Clara Nyquist eller någon av kollegorna i rekryteringsteamet svarar dig gärna på sth5@academicwork.se Ange annons-ID i ditt mail: 15106440

title: Objektledare/Förvaltningsledare
description:
Vi söker dig som har lång erfarenhet från roller som objektledare, förvaltningsledare eller projektledare, IT-projektledare, IT-samordnare, IT-strateg, verksamhetsutvecklare.
 



  





 Du behöver ha en god förmåga att lyssna in kundens behov och tillsammans med kunden skapa en kundunik tillämpning av styrning. Du har erfarenhet, kunskap och intresse för hur olika typer av organisationer styrs utifrån olika förutsättningar. Du behöver även på något sätt ha varit i tidigare kontakt med pm3 modellen.  Tidigare erfarenhet av att arbeta som konsult är starkt meriterande.

title: City Operations Manager (m/w/d) - (Aachen/Stockholm/Thessaloniki)
description:
**Company Description** 




  





 RideMovi is a leading micro-mobility platform that provides sustainable and innovative transportation solutions across Europe. Founded with a vision to revolutionize urban mobility, RideMovi offers a diverse fleet of shared bikes, electric bikes, and electric scooters that are designed to meet the needs of modern cities and their residents.
 



 Operating in more than 24 cities across Europe, including major urban centers like Milan, Barcelona, and Florence, RideMovi is dedicated to reducing traffic congestion, minimizing carbon emissions, and enhancing the quality of life in urban areas. With a user-friendly app, smart lock technology, and station-free design, RideMovi enables seamless, on-demand access to its vehicles, making it easier than ever for people to move around their cities in a healthy, fun, and efficient way.
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 




  




* **Operational Oversight:** 
 Manage and coordinate all aspects of RideMovi's operations in your city, including the deployment, maintenance, and retrieval of bikes, e-bikes, and e-scooters.
* **Fleet Management:** 
 Oversee the distribution and availability of the fleet to ensure that RideMovi’s vehicles are consistently accessible to users in high-demand areas.
* **Data-Driven Decision Making:** 
 Utilize operational data and analytics to make informed decisions regarding fleet distribution, maintenance schedules, and operational efficiencies.
* **Team Leadership:** 
 Lead and manage a local team of technicians, support staff, and contractors to ensure smooth day-to-day operations.
* **Stakeholder Engagement:** 
 Work closely with local authorities, government agencies, and community organizations to comply with local regulations and promote RideMovi’s services.
* **Customer Experience:** 
 Ensure a high standard of customer service and experience by addressing user feedback, resolving operational issues promptly, and enhancing service reliability.
* **Safety Compliance:** 
 Implement and enforce safety protocols for vehicle usage, maintenance, and storage to ensure compliance with local and national regulations.
* **Budget Management:** 
 Oversee the operational budget for your city, ensuring cost-effectiveness while maintaining high service standards.
* **Marketing and Outreach:** 
 Collaborate with the marketing team to execute local promotional activities, increase user engagement, and grow the RideMovi brand presence in your city.



  





**Requirements and Qualifications** 




  




* **Language Proficiency:** 

 Fluency in English is required. Proficiency in the local language (Swedish for Stockholm, German for Aachen, or Greek for Thessaloniki) is essential. Additional language skills are a plus.
* **Education:** 
 A degree in Engineering, Business Administration, Operations Management, Urban Planning, or a related field is preferred.
* **Operations Management Experience:** 
 Proven experience in operations management, with a strong background in logistics and fleet management. Ability to oversee the deployment, maintenance, and retrieval of micromobility vehicles efficiently.
* **Data Analysis and Problem-Solving Skills:** 
 Strong analytical skills to evaluate operational data, generate actionable insights, and implement operational improvements. Demonstrated ability to solve complex problems and make data-driven decisions.
* **Communication and Relationship-Building:** 
 Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain effective relationships with local authorities, stakeholders, and customers. Experience in working collaboratively with government agencies and community organizations.
* **Leadership and Team Management:** 
 Demonstrated leadership skills with the ability to inspire and motivate a diverse team. Experience in leading local teams of technicians, support staff, and contractors to ensure smooth day-to-day operations.
* **Organizational and Time-Management Skills:** 
 Strong organizational skills with the ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities simultaneously. Proven ability to manage time effectively in a fast-paced environment.
* **Adaptability and Independence:** 
 Flexibility to work in a dynamic environment and adapt to the unique challenges and regulations of each city. Ability to work independently as well as collaboratively within a team.
* **Sustainable Mobility and Urban Planning Knowledge:** 
 Familiarity with sustainable mobility practices and urban planning concepts. Understanding of how micromobility solutions can contribute to greener, more connected cities.

title: Business Unit Manager Sweden – To a Microsoft Dynamics Partner
description:
**Do you want to build a new Business Unit in Sweden for one of the largest Microsoft Dynamics partners in Europe?** 




  





 One of the largest Microsoft Dynamics partners in Europe is setting up a Business Unit in Sweden and is looking for an experienced Business Manager with knowledge in the ERP sector—preferably Microsoft Dynamics Finance and Operations.
 



  





 The company is a global IT solutions provider with HQ in Belgium, employing more than 9,000 engaged professionals. They are already active in the Swedish market and now seek to establish a new Business Unit.
 



  





 The company focuses on the process industry, having developed ISV solutions for Pharma, Life Sciences, Medical Devices, Chemicals, and Food & Beverage on top of Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations. They are firmly rooted in these industries and come with an extensive catalog of references.
 



  





 They are a member of the Inner Circle for Microsoft Business Applications and won Partner of the Year 2023 for Western Europe. They have more than 670 Dynamics customers and over 650 Dynamics consultants.
 



  





**Background:** 




 We are looking for someone with a proven track record in selling large ERP projects or with leadership experience in business development or delivery within Microsoft Dynamics Finance and Operations. If you’re eager to build something from the ground up, this is your chance to shape and lead a new Business Unit. Your role will encompass everything from sales and recruitment to P&L responsibility, giving you the opportunity to make a significant impact.
 



  





 This role is perfect for someone with strong drive and a passion for both professional and personal growth. You’ll have the freedom to steer the direction of the business, working independently in a dynamic environment where no two days are the same.
 



  





**Exceptional Support:** 




 While you’ll have the autonomy to lead, you won’t be doing it alone. You’ll receive strong backing from the parent company and the Danish Business Unit, with a team of experienced leaders and consultants ready to support your success. They are committed to ensuring that you and your new Business Unit thrive.
 



  





 In addition, the company’s educational academy is dedicated to continuous learning, offering you and your team the resources to stay at the forefront of industry knowledge and skills.
 



  





**Sweden Today:** 




 The company is already established in Sweden with other subsidiaries, ensuring that support functions are in place for a smooth start-up. This also provides the opportunity for colleagues and various social events from day one. The first consultants are already in place, and the first Swedish customer is onboard, with others on the way.
 



  





**Want to Hear More?** 




 If you are up for an informal chat about the job, feel free to contact Easter Hay, Attn: Kim Mikkelsen, at phone +45 4122 0032 / kimi@easterhay.dk.

title: Säkerhetsarkitekt med gedigen erfarenhet
description:
Vi söker en erfaren säkerhetsarkitekt med en gedigen erfarenhet inom IT infrastruktur, tekniska säkerhetslösningar med fokus på arkitektur och design. I din roll kommer du vara en nyckelperson i att hjälpa kunder med säkerhetsstrategier och säkerhetsgranskningar.
   

  

**Ansvarsområden**
 – Utveckla och implementera robusta IT-säkerhetslösningar med arkitektur som är anspassade efter kundens specifika behov.
   

  

 – Genomföra risk- och säkerhetskgranskningar tillsammans med förslag på förbättringar.
   

  

 – Vara delaktig i projekt och upphandlingar som säkerhetsarkitekt och designa helhetslösningar.
   

  

 – Samarbeta med kunder och hjälpa dem i deras arbete med efterlevnad till gällande säkerhetsstandard och regulatoriska krav.
   

  

**Din erfarenhet**
 – Gedigen erfarenhet som IT-Säkerhetsarkitekt med fokus på tekniska lösningar.
   

  

 – Bakgrund inom IT-infrastruktur, inklusive server, storage och nätverk.
   

  

 – Kompetens inom Cloud Säkerhet och förmågan att implementera säkerhetskontroller i cloud miljöer.
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av informationssäkerhet och IT-säkerhet på operationell, taktisk och strategisk nivå.
   

  

 – Kompetens av regulatoriska krav som NIS Direktivet, GDPR, MSBFS, Dora m fl.
   

  

**Kvalifikationer för rollen**
 – Bachelor’s Degree i IT eller relaterat område.
   

  

 – Relevanta certifieringar som CISSP, CISM, CEH, OCP, CCSP.
   

  

 – Gedigen erfarenhet inom IT-säkerhetsarkitektur, IT-Infrastruktur och Cloud Security kompetens.
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av ramverk och metoder som NIST CSF, CIS18, ISO 2700x, ITIL v3, STRIDE och MITRE ATT&CK.
   

  

 – Erfarenhet av administration och projektarbete som kravanalys, Disaster Recovery och kontinuitetsplanering.
   

  

**Personliga egenskaper**
 – Analytiskt tänkande och problemlösningsförmånga.
   

  

 – Nogrann och fokus på detaljer.
   

  

 – Förmåga att arbeta bra på egen hand men även med grupp.
   

  

 – Utmärk förmåga till samarbete och kommunikation.
   

  

**Om oss**
 Vi på Softronic jobbar ständigt med att förﬂytta våra kunder mot morgondagens teknik. Vare sig det handlar om att utveckla AI, automatisera processer eller modernisera en äldre lösning med bibehållen tillgänglighet. En annan sida av det vi gör är att vi hjälper våra kunder att utveckla innovativa och driftsäkra tjänster som skapar samhällsnytta genom att förenkla människors liv och jobb. På så sätt blir vi och vår teknik en positiv kraft i samhället och en del i att göra världen lite mer hållbar. Det är det vi kallar GoodTech.
   

  

 Vi ser arbetet och arbetsplatsen som en av flera energigivande delar i människans liv. Därför odlar vi aktivt en kultur av gemenskap och lust, där brädspelskvällar, löprundor med kollegorna längs vattnet eller en ﬁka på terrassen är viktigt och ska få lov att ta plats. Genom gemenskap och samhörighet blir det också enklare att tillsammans vidareutveckla våra förmågor, för att i förlängningen kunna vässa vårt erbjudande mot våra kunder.
   

  

**Kontakt**
 Varmt välkommen att kontakta Linda Nyberg på linda.nyberg@softronic.se för mer information.
   

  

 Vi har valt media, säljsamtal undanbedes.
   

  

 Bakgrundskontroll kommer utföras vid rekryteringen.

title: Senior Systemspecialist
description:
Vi har nu ett behov hos en kund efter en Systemspecialist och söker därför en kollega med nedan kvalifikationer. Tjänsten är en del av vår konsultverksamhet vilket innebär att du blir anställd som konsult och arbetar hos kund alt. interna åtaganden gentemot våra kunder.
   

  

**Vår ambitioner**
 Vår målsättning är att vara det ledande IT-konsultföretaget med de mest nöjda medarbetarna och kunderna. Hos oss arbetar du inte för cheferna – ledarskapet är här för att stötta dig. Vi sätter dig i centrum och strävar efter att du ska utvecklas och växa. Vi erbjuder en inspirerande arbetsmiljö med god stämning, intressanta projekt hos intressanta kunder och en stark kultur av kunskapsdelning. Vi har tilltro till våra medarbetares innovationskraft och ger dig och dina kollegor möjlighet att både utvidga och fördjupa era kunskaper.
   

  

**Jobbeskrivning**
 Vi söker en senior systemspecialist med en gedigen erfarenhet av att managera, drifta och utveckla Active directory, Tier0 miljö samt ADFS miljö. On-Prem A. Det är en mix av virtuella och fysiska servrar med 12 domäner med global spridning i världen.
   

  

**Din profil (Skall krav)**
 Vi ser gärna att man har en lång erfarenhet av att ha jobbat med Active directory och har god kännedom om Windows server, Hyper-V och SSO.
   

  

 Arbetet innebär både ansvar för fysisk hårdvara på de Tier0 servar teamet ansvarar för samt patchning, felsökning, loggning, GPOer och högt säkerhetstänk.
   

  

 Vana att arbeta agilt enligt SAFe är en fördel.
   

  

 God kännedom om att hantera Incident, problemhantering och planerade förändringar.
   

  

 God kunskap om Powershell och scriptning samt Jea funktioner.
   

  

**Sista ansökningdatum:** 
 03-09-2024
   

  

**Vi erbjuder dig följande, Valet är ditt!**
 🚀 Spännande uppdrag hos våra många kunder. Vi fokuserar på långsiktiga uppdrag, vilket ger dig möjlighet att skapa värde för kunden samtidigt som du utvecklas själv.
   

  

 🌟 En trygg månadslön – tillsammans bestämmer vi en grundlön baserad på dina uppdrag.
   

  

 🚗 Tjänstebil – vi uppmuntrar dig att välja en elbil för en mer hållbar framtid.
   

  

 💼 Tjänstepension och stora möjligheter till löneväxling.
   

  

 🌴 Semester - Önskar du mer än 30 dagar semester?
   

  

 🏥 Privat sjukvårdsförsäkring, olycksfallsförsäkring och livförsäkring för ökad trygghet.
   

  

 📚 Kompetensutveckling – du får själv sätta din budget och välja vilka utbildningar du vill delta i.
   

  

 🕑 Livskvalitet - Har du kanske svårt att få ihop pusslet i vardagen och önskar arbeta lite mindre och ändå kunna tjäna lika mycket om inte mer?
   

  

**Om Deploja**
 Vi sysselsätter idag seniora IT-specialister, inom bl.a. utveckling, test, testledning, projektledning, databas, Drift, Linux och ser oss alltid om efter fler kompetenta medarbetare.
   

  

 Transparens och flexibilitet är i alla fall viktigt för oss, med oss får man som konsult majoriteten av sin egen intäkt, i snitt har våra medarbetare höjt sin ersättning med 43% och har samtidigt ett av marknadens bästa förmånspaket. De som är med på vår resa idag har en trygg anställning MEN sätter sin egen lön och bestämmer själva över sina förmåner så som pension, utbildning, arbetstid och tjänstebil.
   

  

 Våra kunder finns bland annat inom detaljhandel, bank/finans/försäkring, energi, transport och offentlig sektor. De flesta av våra kunder är i Stockholmsregionen men vi har även kunder i andra delar av landet.
   

  

* Vi hanterar ansökningar löpande, med hänsyn till höga arbetstrycket och semestertider dröjer återkoppling längre än vanligt.

title: Cloud Technical Architect
description:
Atos supports the digital transformation of its clients across all business sectors. Become part of our Cloud Competence Practice and work as a lead technical architect in a challenging enterprise environment.
   

  

**Your role as a Cloud Architect @Atos**
* We are looking for a Cloud Technical Architect to work on internal and customer projects for a broad variety of clients worldwide. This position provides you with autonomy, flexibility and of course enough challenges to learn and develop your professional as well your personal skills. Your work location will be at one of our offices in the Netherlands or at a customer site.
* Your day-to-day responsibilities will include
* working towards completing architecture/design and implementation of services to manage and migrate workloads to cloud-based PaaS, IaaS and SaaS products
* responsible for leading the creation of technology frameworks and providing technical leadership in internal and customer initiatives with a focus on the design of cloud-based services across the stack including Microservices, Containers, Container Platforms and DevOps
* engage with customers to understand their business challenges and requirements and help the customer’s design & implement new methodologies and IT service frameworks and maximize the business around the cloud service platforms
* work with customers throughout the whole modernization journey, providing comprehensive support to transform and evolve their application portfolios via native cloud development from strategy, to implementation to operations
* transforming legacy applications using modern secure software development methods with a set of proven DevSecOps practices to create the right environment to rapidly launch new services to customers


**Skills We'd Like You To Have**
* Master’s or Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a relevant professional qualification
* Experience in customer facing roles and success leading deep technical architecture and application design discussions with senior customer executives to drive cloud deployment
* Deep understanding and experience in working with one or more Public Cloud environments (AWS, Azure, Google) and on-premises environments
* Deep understanding of cloud computing technologies, business drivers, and emerging trends
* Solid understanding of cloud virtualization, storage and networking & security solutions
* Understanding of cloud governance technologies for cost management and control
* Deep understanding of cloud-based Business Continuity and Disaster Recovery practices
* Proven track record of driving decisions collaboratively, resolving conflicts & ensuring follow-up
* Presentation skills with a high degree of comfort with both large and small audiences
* Prior work experience in a consulting/architecture position within software & services company
* Takes ownership and shows commitment, team player with an open mind and positive attitude
* Exceptional verbal and written communication
* Preferred language Dutch or English business fluent


**We offer**
 At Atos, technology and innovation are central. Atos wants to be an inspiring and facilitating employer, so that you continue to develop and improve yourself professionally and personally. Because even if you are an experienced professional, it is essential to keep up and develop yourself. Our Atos University offers many possibilities for this. The benefits we offer are
   

  

* A good salary and attractive benefits (such as an end-of-year bonus and a pension scheme)
* An informal working atmosphere with result-oriented colleagues and an involved manager
* 29 vacation days per year
* A lease car or mobility budget
* Flexible working comes in many forms at Atos. From part-time work arrangements to flexibility in where you work, when you work and how you work. For this role remote working is possible.
* The opportunity to work on complex projects for appealing clients where you can develop yourself
* Excellent (international) career opportunities
* Extensive training and development programs
* Competency groups where you can learn from others and share your own experiences.

title: Consultants to IFS Cloud
description:
There is never a typical day at Accenture, but that’s why we love it here! You now have the opportunity to build a rewarding career as an
 **IFS Cloud consultant** 
 at Accenture Technology . If you’re looking for a challenging career working in a vibrant environment with access to training, cutting edge technology and a global network of experts, this could be the role for you.
   

  

 We will give you the opportunity to grow personally and professionally in a dynamic environment. Our projects are built on cooperation and teamwork and you will find yourself working together with other talented, passionate and dedicated consultants towards a shared goal. We are working in international teams, where you will work with colleagues from other offices and offshore delivery centers.
   

  

**Work you will do as a IFS Cloud consultant**
- As an IFS Cloud consultant professional, you are likely to be responsible for leading functional and/or technical design and developing cutting edge technology solutions

- You will use your skills working with IFS Cloud and using the latest technologies in the most interesting and most demanding projects – where your contribution will make a difference to the customer!

- Solve complex client problems by working in multinational teams on client-facing projects

- Work with tasks such as creating business cases, proposal development and presentations to client stakeholders

- Be part of high performing teams, learning from and supporting each other develop every day

- Engage in internal Accenture initiatives of your choice, such as recruiting and community activities

**Who We Are Looking For**
 We are looking for candidates who have
   

  

  

- Completed a Bachelor’s or Master's degree

- Over all at least 8 – 10 years of professional experience and at least 5 years of relevant IFS experience

- IFS Cloud – ERP, FSM/MWO or IFS Technical experience

- Ability to work independently and as a team member

- Strong supervisory and coaching skills

- Ability to be flexible and work analytically in a problem-solving environment

- Willingness and ability to quickly learn new concepts and technologies

- Passionate about innovation and delivery of the latest technologies to your clients

- Excellent communication (verbal and written) and presentation skills to address technical and non-technical audiences in English and Nordic language

**Locations**
 We are looking for candidates to join our offices in Stockholm, Gothenburg and Malmö. Mobility and flexibility to either work physically at an office (client or Accenture), or in a virtual “home office” is expected. This requires you to both have a high degree of flexibility for travelling to our clients or working with international teams virtually.
   

  

 We look forward to receiving your application!
   

  

 Due to the summer holiday season, our response times might be a bit longer than usual. Please note that we will review your application in the beginning of August and get back to you shortly after.
   

  

*Equal is greater than - Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, age, ethnicity, culture, race, religion and belief, disability, nationality, sexual orientation, and gender identity. Inclusion and diversity are fundamental to our culture and core values, providing an environment where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!*

title: QA Architect
description:
**Who we are**
 Telenor is rapidly heading towards the digital future and we are looking for brilliant people to join our digital transformation journey in Sweden. Do you have an interest in technology and would like to challenge the telecom industry and want to create great customer experiences? Do you have a sense of humor and prefer seeking solutions rather than pointing out problems? Then, please keep on reading.
   

  

**We are transforming**
 At Telenor we are accelerating our digital transformation. In the Consumer IT Tribe, we are building a modern and fast-paced software development organization with a mission to enable and accelerate Telenor Sweden's Consumer business. We have the accountability to provide fast-paced software development from business support systems up to the channel layer.
   

  

**What you will do**
 Your role is to provide technical leadership and strategic direction for Quality Assurance in Consumer IT. You will drive the initiatives to reach the strategic ambition and work closely with the organization to meet the quality objectives of Consumer IT. You are expected to be able to affect change not only across the testing community, but to influence and inspire to uphold the highest standards of quality across all engineering disciplines. You will offer thoughtful guidance, feedback, and innovative suggestions to improve quality practices across Consumer IT. Additionally, you will:
   

  

* Mentor and empower the QA organization.
* Establish design principles for QA automation and non-functional testing.
* Design and architect modular and reusable automated testing solutions and test automation frameworks.
* Collaborate closely with the organization to uncover new automation opportunities and leverage AI to enhance efficiency throughout the software development lifecycle.
* Support the team that manages the test environments.
* Stay current with advancements in automation methodologies and tools.
* Research, evaluate and implement new test tools.
* Train and guide team members in best practices for testing and QA.


**Who you are**
 You are a seasoned QA professional within software development, used to work in an agile context. You have a passion for quality and years of experience working with complex business-critical solutions. Your communication skills are excellent, both to developers as well as to top management, and you excel at translating complex technical concepts into clear, non-technical language. You are always striving for improvements and love to understand current challenges and how to mitigate them. You are self-motivated and do not need others to tell you what to do.
   

  

 You have been instrumental in developing and implementing testing strategies within large-scale corporate environments, demonstrating strong leadership and stakeholder management skills. You are not afraid to challenge yourself and your colleagues to get the work done. With experience in scripting and development across multiple programming languages, you have experience of QA in the cloud and are familiar with regulatory compliance, data privacy, and cybersecurity best practices.
   

  

 Your track record includes evaluating and adopting test automation frameworks, developing in-house automation tools, and using platforms like JIRA, Confluence, and TestFLO or similar tools. You also bring expertise in functional and non-functional testing, along with continuous integration practices using tools like Jenkins.
   

  

**Our promise**
 A balanced workforce is key to our success. To secure that, we’re committed to fostering a working environment where our employees are supported and empowered in all areas of their work. We promise you a company eager to learn and rapidly adapt to a digital world where you will be welcomed into a skilled team of professional and knowledgeable colleagues. In addition, you will get:
   

  

* A flexible way of work – We believe that flexibility and freedom to choose where and how to execute your work is a driver for performance, engagement and work life balance. We also believe in the power of better together and that the team spirit develops when we meet and interact in person, therefor our offices act as magnets for collaboration, creativity and company spirit
* A generous health and benefit package with for example wellness grant, health insurance, ”give me a break”-days, occupational pension and much more.
* Development programs to deepen your knowledge and broaden the competence


**Come join the team**
 If you would like to know more, please contact Cajsa Lundström, cajsa.lundstrom@telenor.se.
   

  

**Good to know**
 We recognize the power of diverse teams, and therefore we encourage everyone to apply for this position.
   

  

 Application deadline: we evaluate candidates continuously so please apply today.
   

  

 Location: Stockholm
   

  

 According to Telenor's policy, we conduct background checks on the final candidate for all recruitments.

title: SAP integration Lead
description:
**SAP Integration Lead.**




  





 Salary range: As per market trend
 



 Fixed Term / Permanent – Fixed Team – 6 months or 12 months
 



 Stockholm or Lund when required
 



 Language preference - English
 



  





 Required skills
 


* SAP BTP
* SAP Integration Suite



  





 Preferred skills
 


* Seeburger
* Biztalk
* Greenfield projects
* Our operations and how we support our customers is undergoing a major business transformation, a Greenfield implementation of SAP to support business transformation. A key role in this business and IT transformation journey is our Integration Lead.
* You will be a key player in one of our biggest business transformation programs ever.
* As part of this Greenfield program, we will replace many of our existing solutions and processes with new solutions from SAP.



  





**Purpose of role and key responsibilities** 




 You will be our senior integration designer and advisor. As such, you will lead the work to define our future integration architecture, design and operations, in close cooperation with business and IT stakeholders, as well as with SAP and our implementation partner You are a strong advocate and gatekeeper for our principles: standardization, harmonization & simplification.
 



 Specific tasks, skills and behaviours includes:
 



 • Co-exist architecture and design. You drive the migration from, and decommissioning of, our legacy platforms; together with representatives from our partners.
 



 • You guide other projects and initiatives towards our target architecture and design. And support with knowledge, guidelines, frameworks etc.
 



 • Responsible for the operations of our integration platform.
 



 • Guidelines/instructions are developed and maintained. Deviations from agreed design principles and ways of working are lifted.
 



 • Strong communication and interpersonal skills, as Integration Lead you will work closely with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
 



 • Upon completion of our transformation program, you will continue to be part of the SAP CoE supporting the continuous business development and improvement journey.
 



  





  





  





 To be successful in this role, you:
 



 • Have minimum 6 years of experience in a similar senior role within integration platforms, with a strong understanding of SAP’s newer integration capabilities within Integration Suite and BTP.
 



 Experience from our current integration platforms, Biztalk and Seeburger is strong advantage.
 



 • A similarly strong competence in integration concepts, methodologies and patterns.
 



 • Have been involved in large SAP implementations, preferably greenfield projects and are familiar with SAP’s solution landscape as well as best practices, methods and tools from SAP.
 



 • Contribute with drive, leadership and a positive attitude. You speak up and have opinions, backed up by guiding principles, target architecture, program playbook etc.

title: Microsoft Dynamic 365 Finance Consultant
description:
**About the Role:** 




  






 We are seeking an experienced Senior Finance Functional Consultant with a strong background in Microsoft Dynamics 365 to join our team in Stockholm. In this role, you will lead and manage the implementation of Dynamics 365 Finance modules across full-cycle projects, ensuring seamless integration and functionality that meet our business needs. If you have a passion for finance technology and a proven track record in D365 Finance and Operations, we would love to hear from you!
 




  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Lead and manage the implementation of Dynamics 365 Finance modules in full-cycle projects.
* Provide deep functional knowledge and hands-on expertise in MS Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations, including modules such as General Ledger, Accounts Receivable, Accounts Payable, Cash & Bank, Budgeting, Credit & Collections, Inventory Management, Sales & Marketing, Procurement & Sourcing, and Product Information Management.
* Write comprehensive documentation including Requirements documents, Functional Design documents, Change Requests, Training manuals, and Test scripts.
* Perform data migration routines: extract data from legacy systems, transform data, and load data to D365 using the Data Management module.
* Manage configuration tasks using the Data Management module, including copying configurations between legal entities and transferring configurations between different environments.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless integration of finance and supply chain modules.
* Provide training and support to end-users to ensure the effective use of Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations.
* Maintain up-to-date knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations and relevant Trade & Logistics certifications.



  





**Required Qualifications:** 



* Senior functional consultant with 10+ years of experience.
* Extensive experience with Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations, particularly with finance-related modules.
* Proven experience in full-cycle D365 implementation projects.
* Strong expertise in data migration and configuration management using the Data Management module.
* Excellent documentation skills including writing Requirements documents, Functional Design documents, and Training manuals.
* Ability to work collaboratively in a cross-functional team environment.
* Strong communication skills to provide training and support to end-users.
* Relevant Microsoft Dynamics 365 Finance and Operations certifications.



  





**How to Apply:** 





 If you are a highly skilled Finance Functional Consultant with a passion for Dynamics 365 and a commitment to excellence, we would love to hear from you! Please apply with your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience at Please apply with your resume and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience at
 
 https://lnkd.in/dufb6Dv6
 
 . In case of any questions, please write to
 
 shivani@vipas.se
 
 .
 




  






 Vipas is an equal-opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

title: Delivery Lead Senior Manager
description:
**Delivery Lead Senior Manager, Stockholm**
**Transforming Technology Experience**
**Industrial and engineering**
 Do you enjoy working with clients and helping them to build their future success? Are you passionate about technology and the many ways it can help enterprises solve their biggest challenges? Do you want to work in the conjunction of business, technology, innovation, and change, and make incredible things happen? Great! Keep reading.
   

  

 We offer a fantastic opportunity to shape your own success as a
 **Delivery Lead Senior Manager in Accenture Technology** 
 where rubber meets the road on making technology work for the enterprise. As a Delivery Lead Senior Manager in Sweden, you will work closely with our Swedish clients and client group leadership in growing our Technology business through overseeing the delivery of key engagements and participating in sales. At the same time, you will be accountable for the technology business outcomes internally and developing the team and people around you.
   

  

 Our Products client group offers a great platform to constantly grow and learn, as our clients are at the forefront of technological development, solving complex business challenges and undergoing large transformations. We help our industrial clients in a variety of different areas: shifting to aaS business models, reinventing product and service portfolios, transforming supply chains, manufacturing, and core operations, building rich customer experiences – just to name a few examples.
   

  

 To help you succeed you will have strong support of well-functioning global network of experts, who can help bringing the latest thinking and best practices to life for your clients. You get to broaden your perspectives by interacting with brilliant minds and people from many backgrounds and cultures.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
- Lead the end-to-end delivery for a contract, to meet operational, contractual, and economic commitments. Drive follow-on work by up-selling and or cross-selling the contract.

- Developing and maintaining strong relationships with clients assigned to you.

- Communicate across multiple stakeholders to manage expectations, issues, and outcomes.

- Building long-term, profitable growth by driving new sales and overseeing high-quality technology project deliveries to meet and exceed client expectations.

- Collaborating with your colleagues and ecosystem partners globally to bring new and innovative ideas and solutions to help your clients.

- Contributing towards the growth of our team & and the development of our people

**Requirements:**
- Deep experience in designing, delivering as well as solutioning and selling technology solutions to enterprises.

- Background in engineering or manufacturing

- Experience and ideally existing relationships in one of the following industries: industrial, manufacturing, engineering.

- Ability to lead complex technology implementations and ongoing technology operations (application and / or infrastructure)

- Skills in both modern technologies (like data & Gen AI, cloud) as well as in working with enterprise’s major technology solutions (key applications or infrastructure, service management or equivalent)

- Strong inter-personal skills and the ability to influence, collaborate, partner, motivate and build relationships.

- Excellent communication (written and oral) skills in English and Swedish (preferred, not required)

**What we offer to you:**
- Collaborate with exceptional people and work with the most interesting and challenging projects, utilizing cutting-edge technologies, and partnering with industry-leading companies.

- Health insurance, culture & sports benefits: access to several social activities through active corporate fun club

- Volunteer roles and events through our internal network.

- A variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialized skills faster.

- Personal Mentor to guide your career within Accenture´s global possibilities.

- Work-life balance: good arrangements to combine family life with work and active support for mental health.

**Apply now**
 This job is based in Stockholm, Sweden. Apply online below. Remember to attach CV and cover letter. We look forward to receiving your application.
   

  

 Accenture welcomes and encourages applications from a diverse group of backgrounds related to gender, ethnicity, culture, age etc. We provide an environment of inclusion and diversity where everyone brings distinct experience, talent, and culture to their work. We invite you to be part of this diversity!

title: Senior Test Engineer to leading energy company!
description:
Take part of the journey in electrifying Sweden!
   

 As a Test Engineer, you are offered a varied role within an agile environment with testing. If you have extensive experience in testing and want to take the next step in your career, this is the perfect job for you.
 


  


 Apply today!
 


 Apply here!
 
  

**City :**
 Solna / Stockholm
 



  

**Job Category :**
 IT
 



  

**Extent :**
 Full time
 



  

**Start date :**
 As soon as possible
 



  

**Type of work :**
 Staffing
 



  

**Other :**
 Possibility to work remote
   




**About the role**

 Our client is a leading Nordic energy company. Their purpose is to power a world where people, businesses and nature thrive together. They are one of the cleanest energy producers in Europe and their actions are guided by their ambitious environmental targets. They generate and deliver clean energy reliably and help industries to decarbonise their processes and grow.
 


  


 Our client is now looking for a Senior Test Engineer to join their team. This department is building a system to make energy consumption smarter for end customers. The system does this by controlling energy-consuming devices in your home, such as your electric car or heater, to lower your costs while also helping to balance the electrical grid. This ultimately benefits the consumer, the power system, and the environment. In other words: Win-win-win!
 


  


  

**You are offered**



  

  
* A dedicated consultant manager
  
* A chance to be a part of a growth journey at one of the leading company within electricity and smart energy
  

  


**Work tasks**

 As a Test Automation Engineer you will be responsible for ensuring that the right things are tested (having a test plan/test strategy) and that you have the correct test coverage of different features. Since the product and the existing tests are written in Java/JUnit, we require a solid foundation in Java programming for this role. You will work closely with developers in an agile team that should be encouraged to write tests themselves, but you will be driving test automation, security testing, performance testing, and test management, and will be responsible for ensuring quality in the project.
 


  


 In this role it is very important to have a strong testing mindset and previous experience of working in an agile environment. You enjoy working in a multilingual and multicultural environment and have good communication skills.
 


  

  
* Write automated tests for backend and frontend
  
* Use existing tools or recommend new tools, which ever is most accurate to the project
  
* Work closely with a development team to produce robust test cases
  
* Ensure transparency of test results and system coverage.
  
* Execute reviews of test automation
  

  


**We are looking for**
  
* 5+ years of experience within the Test Engineering field
  
* Practical knowledge of test automation frameworks.
  
* Implementation and deployment of automated end-to-end test suites (test case definition, test coverage planning, risk-based testing)
  
* API testing, mobile application testing, web application testing and integration testing in a cloud environment.
  
* Aligning testing with agile software development
  
* Basic knowledge of OCPP, MQTT, AWS technologies is a must.
  
* Full professional proficiency in English, both written and spoken.
  


  


  

**These are examples of tools and frameworks that will occur in the role:**



  

  
* Confluence
  
* Rapid7
  
* AWS IoT
  
* Pulsar
  
* Docker
  
* Cucumber
  
* Gherkin Language
  
* Zephyr
  
* Playwright, Appium
  
* Postman/Insomnia
  
* MongoDB, MySQL
  
* iOS and Android emulators
   

 We would prefer if you have had experience with any of these systems.
  


  


  

**It is meritorious if you have**



  

  
* Kotlin.
  
* Python.
  
* Prior experience with electric vehicle chargers, home energy management.
  
* Knowledge of electricity flexibility markets, smart charging, smart heating, charge point management systems, and electric vehicles.
  


  

  

**Our recruitment process**
  


 This recruitment process is handled by Academic Work and it is our client’s wish that all questions regarding the position is directed to Academic Work.
 


  


 Our selection process is continuous and the advert may close before the recruitment process is completed if we have moved forward to the next phase. The process includes two tests: one personality test and one cognitive test. The tests are tools to find the right talent for the right position, to enable equality, diversity, and a fair process.
   




**Become a part of Academic Work**

 When you apply to this job, you are becoming one of many consultants at Academic Work. This means that not only will you gain fantastic benefits, but also a team of consultant managers to support you through your career with us.
 


 Read more about Academic Work
   

**Do you have questions about this job?**

 Filippa Danell Karlberg or a colleague in the recruitment team will gladly answer you on sth2@academicwork.se Please specify advert-ID in your email: 15106514

title: Teknisk Projektledare
description:
**Kungl. Lawn Tennis Klubben söker Teknisk Projektledare** 




  





*KLTK är en av Europas ledande tennisklubbar, med en unik hall- och parkanläggning centralt i Stockholm. Här spelas tennis på motions- och elitnivå i alla åldrar, och klubben rymmer 21 tennisbanor, restaurang, lounger, gym, pool, squash och rekreationsytor. Utöver medlemsaktiviteter arrangerar KLTK två stora årliga internationella tennistävlingar för världseliten, och tillhandahåller konferens- och eventmöjligheter.* 




  





*Nu söker vi en teknikutbildad och inititativtagande person som med fördel också är tennisintresserad!* 




  





**Om tjänsten:** 




  





 KLTK söker en driven och engagerad Teknisk Projektledare som vill vara med och utveckla klubbens digitala närvaro och tekniska lösningar. I denna roll kommer du att arbeta nära vår Klubbchef och vara en nyckelperson i att driva tekniska projekt framåt, och vara beställare gentemot konsulter. Du kommer att ansvara för att utveckla och underhålla vår hemsida samt hantera olika tekniska projekt som stödjer klubbens verksamhet. Du kommer att ansvara för vårt digitala medlemssystem som är hjärtat i hela verksamheten. Systemet styr det mesta som medlemmarna gör på klubben; boka tennis, behandlingar och tränare, men även funktioner som ekonomi, belysning, banbevattning, nyckelkoder. Rollen innebär också att du kommer vara delaktig i att förbättra vår externa kommunikation, både vad gäller plattformar och innehåll. Du rapporterar till klubbchefen och generalsekreteraren.
 



  





**Dina ansvarsområden kommer att inkludera:** 




  




* Leda och genomföra tekniska projekt från start till mål.
* Utveckla och underhålla KLTK:s hemsidor.
* Ansvara för extern kommunikation och innehållshantering på digitala plattformar.
* Utveckla och underhålla klubbens bokningssystem KLTK Volley.
* Hantera leverantörskontakter och säkerställa att tekniska lösningar levereras enligt överenskommelse.
* Samarbeta med olika avdelningar inom klubben för att identifiera och implementera tekniska förbättringar.
* Ge teknisk support och lösningsorienterad service till medlemmar och personal.



  





**Bakgrund och erfarenhet:** 




  





 Vi ser gärna att du tidigare jobbat med teknisk projektledning i allmänhet och webb, hemsidor och kommunikation i synnerhet. Du är van att jobba i en mindre organisation där du haft ett brett ansvar och du blivit en naturlig go-to person för frågor inom teknik och IT. Du är servicinriktad och van att möta verksamhetens krav och förväntningar på IT och är mån om att leverera stabila och effektiva lösningar, ofta genom externa leverantörer. Du har yrkes- eller akademisk utbildning inom IT/teknik. Vi tror också du har ett genuint intresse för tennis!
 



  





**Personliga egenskaper:** 




  





 Vi söker dig som är självgående, strukturerad och har ett stort personligt driv. Du är nyfiken och har en hög integritet, är lösningsorienterad och har en god förmåga att prioritera och samarbeta. Som person är du kommunikativ och duktig på att skapa nya relationer, både internt och externt. Du har en passion för teknik och tennis, och vill bidra till att KLTK fortsätter att vara en ledande tennisklubb i Sverige.
 



  





**Låter det intressant?** 




  





 Vid intresse för tjänsten och för eventuella frågor, kontakta:
 



 Charlotta Skogar, 0761664878
 



 Sven Borres, 0763184269
 



 Urval sker löpande varpå vi gärna ser din ansökan så snart som möjligt, dock senast den 20 september 2024.
 



 Välkommen med din ansökan!

title: Talent Acquisition Partner
description:
**What We Do At Qliro**
 At Qliro, we deliver safe and simple payment solutions. We are a dedicated partner to our merchants, who serve their customers every day. We believe that when our merchants grow, we grow. We are a company of dedicated, friendly, and highly competent people who have redefined what Qliro and payments can be. We are now on a journey to scale our business both in Sweden and across the Nordics.
   

  

**What Your Team Does**
 You will be part of a dedicated People team consisting of a Talent Acquisition Partner, two People Partners, and our Chief People Officer, supporting all of Qliro from a talent and people perspective. Your role as a Talent Acquisition Partner is both operational and strategic. We take the recruitment of our future colleagues seriously — how else are we going to be the best in our field? As a Talent Acquisition Partner, you are integral to ensuring that we, as a company, can fulfill our strategy and reach our goals. You do this through a genuine interest in the business, learning and understanding who we need on board to achieve our objectives. You will continuously challenge and support our leaders in attracting and hiring the best talent for Qliro. Additionally, you will be responsible for leading various talent projects and initiatives across the organisation, as well as setting and following the strategic agenda of the People team to support Qliro’s overall strategy.
   

  

**What You’ll Do**
* Drive recruitment for a variety of roles across the organization, providing a high level of service to both candidates and hiring managers
* Coach and partner with functional leads and managers on all matters relating to their recruitment and staffing needs, both operational and strategic
* Run and implement strategic development projects and processes with your team or stakeholders in the organisation
* Collaborate with the rest of the People team to ensure we are prepared to scale as we expand into new countries


**We Believe You, as Our Talent Acquisition Partner, Can:**
 Easily gain trust and collaborate, communicate, and influence at all levels. We also believe you are a self-starter and self-organizer who can independently drive your work forward, create engagement, and gain trust. We see you as an analytical and structured person with a progressive mindset. You thrive in a role where you won’t be micromanaged but where you are expected to take charge and test ideas.
   

  

**What You Will Bring To The Team**
* Experience working in an in-house, end-to-end recruitment role for a few years, where you've managed the recruitment process from the initial meeting to the signed contract
* A proven track record of driving recruitment and acting as an advisor and partner to hiring managers
* Experience in fast-paced and entrepreneurial environments
* Involvement in or leadership of process improvements, strategic initiatives, or projects related to talent attraction.Fluency in Swedish and English (English is our corporate language)
* While experience recruiting for tech roles is highly beneficial, it’s more important that you are curious about understanding the organization, our business, and the kind of people we need to reach our goals


**Does this sound like your next role? What are you waiting for—apply now!**

title: Technical Customer Success Manager - Nordics
description:
**About Proxify** 




  





 Proxify is Europe’s largest network of deeply vetted software engineers. We drive tech success by bridging the talent gap. Our mission is to connect the world’s best developers with the opportunities they deserve. We partner with more than 2000 companies in 30 different countries, ranging from SaaS startups, Fintech, and Deeptech companies within AI to established enterprises within Media, Electronics, and Finance.
 



  





***Interested in being a driving force in our fast-growing Nordic market?***




  





 We're on the lookout for a high-performing, yet humble
 *Technical Customer Success Manager* 
 with a strong tech background and interest to play a pivotal role in our rapid expansion within the Nordic market. As one of Europe's fastest-growing companies in the industry, expanding in the Nordics remains a key strategic goal.
 



  





 As part of the Client Management team, you’ll be responsible for growing our client partnerships as well as initiating long-term collaborations between clients and developers. As our future
 **Technical Customer Success Manager** 
 , you’ll focus on the Nordic countries where the demand for skilled developers is growing.
 



  





**What your week will look like:** 




  





**Facilitate regular Client check-ins:** 
 Interact with CTOs, CEOs, and Engineering Managers. The primary goal is to ensure client satisfaction and quickly address potential issues.
 



**Identify and resolve Client challenges:** 
 Become the in-the-known-friend by proactively identifying and guiding clients through their competence related challenges. This involves deeply understanding their technical roadmap and needs.
 



**Work with feedback and improvement:** 
 Actively seek and incorporate feedback from clients to continuously refine and enhance Proxify’s service offering.
 



**Onboard new Clients:** 
 Lead the onboarding process for new clients, ensuring they are fully equipped with the tools and resources to succeed with Proxify. This involves introducing them to our platform, processes, and ways-of-working.
 



  





**Why you’ll love this opportunity at Proxify:** 




  





 🌐 Get the possibility to solve most tech teams’ biggest challenge - bridging their competence gap - and at the same time offer great opportunities to developers around the world
 



 ❤️ Join a team of tech lovers where support and humility are our guiding principles
 



 📈 Spearhead the growth of client partnerships in the Nordic countries
 



 🚀 Great opportunities for professional development and personal growth
 



 ✈️ Work in a truly international environment where we from time to time meet and spend quality time together (our team spanning 39 countries!)
 



  





**To be successful in this role, we believe that you:** 




  




* Have hands-on experience with technology, such as working as a technical project manager, product manager, developer, or a similar role, ideally within a tech team
* Have an intrinsic sense of urgency, responsibility and ownership
* Are passionate about closing the competence gap in tech
* Possess a curiosity about technological innovations and trends, continually seeking to understand how they can be leveraged to solve real-world problems and improve efficiency
* Understand how to help a client and guiding them through the customer journey
* Are not just a talker; you make things happen and pay keen attention to details!



  





**Why it may not be your match:** 




  





 ❌ You like everyday to look the same (clear routines and process), this might not be for you because we build as we go and keep agile
 



 ❌ You don't have any technical experience
 



 ❌ You don’t speak Swedish on a native level
 



  





 At Proxify, we believe that together, we can achieve our dreams. Anything is possible, with the right people. Are you in?
 



  





 Be our guest and visit our website to learn more about us. Can’t wait to meet you! 🚀
 



  





*Kindly submit your application and CV in English, as this is the standardized language we use at Proxify.*

title: Senior Financial Crime Risk Officer
description:
**Job Description**
*Would you like to combine your own expertise with coordinating other experts across your own team and sister teams, while working with a broad range of stakeholders across countries? And are you interested in joining a specialised team within one of the group’s key focus areas – 1st Line Financial Crime? Then keep on reading!*
**Senior Financial Crime Risk Officer to join our team**
 Danske Bank’s 1 st Line Financial Crime Risk Assessments team is recruiting for our strategic risk assessments section. We are searching for a senior colleague to join our team.
   

  

 The position can be based in any of the Nordic countries (Denmark, Finland, Norway and Swe­den) or in Poland. In all locations, you will be working together with colleagues in the Financial Crime unit under a hybrid working model – note that we do not offer a fully remote position.
   

  

 The tasks in our Strategic Risk Assessments section focus on the Group-Wide Risk Assessment (GWRA) and country-wide Financial Crime Risk Assessments (FCRA). In the section, we have a leading role in delivering analysis and reporting on FC risks to each of Danske Bank’s country branches, while we act as SMEs and first-line sparring partners for our counterparts in the GWRA team within Group Compliance for the Group-wide reporting. We work with business units and subsidiaries across all countries, where Danske Bank does business.
   

  

**Enhancing your expertise in Strategic Assessment**
 As a senior team member, we will help you build on your existing skills to become one of our key experts within strategic risk assessment. We will agree detailed responsibilities based on your experience and interests, but in general, you can expect to become a senior subject-matter expert for the team and the Group for one or more of the topics that make up the GWRA / FCRA.
   

  

 Here is an example of what your tasks could look like:
   

  

* Working with large scale (such as enterprise- or division-level) risk assessments.
* Performing targeted risk assessment or other analysis.
* Working with additional financial crime risks besides money laundering and terrorist financing.
* Providing written and verbal narratives for one or more of enterprise-level risk assessments, internal/external audits, regulatory authorities, or other control functions.
* Producing quality dashboards, PowerPoints etc. for senior management.
* Training and guiding more junior colleagues.


 To meet the requirements of the job, we imagine that you have a background similar to this:
   

  

* A minimum of 3 years of relevant experience, with good working knowledge of Financial Crime risks and/or controls.
* Experience with stakeholder management, including to advise and guide stakeholders.
* Experience running established processes independently or with little guidance needed.
* Understanding of financial services and banking industry processes.
* Excellent written and spoken English.


**Does this sound like you? Then please get in touch with us.**
 If you have any questions about the role, you are welcome to contact the leader of 1 st Line FC GWRA / FCRA & Product Risk Assessment, Jesper Søndergaard at jsnd@danskebank.dk .
   

  

 Please note that we may select candidates for interviews on an on-going basis, and this job posting will be closed once we find our preferred new colleague
   

  

**We look forward to hearing from you!**
 #FI
   

  

 #SE
   

  

 #NO
   

  

 #PL
   

  

**About Us**
 Danske Bank is a Nordic bank with bridges to the world around us. For 150 years, we have supported people and businesses in releasing their potential. A career with us is an opportunity to join a community of 22,000 colleagues in a culture where we are committed to Teaming Up, Owning It and Being Open. Together, we are on a journey to transform Danske Bank into a better bank. For our customers, our employees and the societies around us.

title: Head of Group Property
description:
*We are looking for a person with high business acumen to lead a unit responsible for a great team of 35 co-workers in Sweden divided in 4 subunits. Group Property manage a portfolio of almost 1,500 000 sqm for + 23.000 staff located at around 80 sites world wide with the main part in Sweden. Join us on our mission to keep people and societies safe!*
 Your role
   

  

 In the position as Vice President, Head of Group Property you will be responsible for Saab’s growing real estate portfolio and capital projects, developing strategies and policies to ensure long term cost effectiveness and financial output. You will lead a stakeholder driven organization that manage and develop Saab’s property portfolio.
   

  

 In this role you are accountable for creating a culture that enhances and promotes performance, innovation and motivation. The Head of Group Property reports to Senior Vice President & Head of Operational Excellence and is part of the Operational Excellence Management team.
   

  

 Our operations and your teams are geographically spread on our major sites throughout Sweden so frequent travelling is required.
   

  

 You will be accountable for:
   

  

* Manage and develop Saabs global real estate portfolio
* Manage investments, acquisitions and sales of property and land
* Manage major infrastructure and construction projects
* Manage proactively internal stakeholders
* Manage large partner contracts within facility management, security, food & beverage and IT
* Analyze new opportunities in line with business needs and the Saab Group strategy
* Define and develop property policies and strategies aligned with the overall strategy
* Drive digitalization, operational excellence and efficiency


 Your profile
   

  

 You are trusting, inspiring and coach your team to high level of performance. You have excellent interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills, developing strategic directions based on the business need and Saab’s strategy.
   

  

 You possess a strong business acumen and are forward-thinking within Real Estate and Facility Management. When collaborating with stakeholders, you are confident with the ability to build relationships, influence and provide advice to key decision makers. You have a successful track record in your leadership skills as well as your cooperation skills with different suppliers.
   

  

 Required background:
   

  

* Broad professional experience from heading real estate, facility management, capital projects and transactions within large international organizations
* Experience from managing a large investment portfolio
* Experience from negotiating and sourcing, especially leasing and letting
* Experienced Senior Leader with extensive knowledge in development and empowerment of direct reports and staff
* Experience in navigation and efficient work in a matrix organization
* Experience in stakeholder management to connect with business
* Relevant academic degree
* Fluent in English and Swedish, both verbally and in writing


 Required personality:
   

  

* Strong analytical, problem-solving skills and solution oriented
* Ability to communicate effectively with all levels in the organization, verbally and in writing
* Displays honesty, integrity, fairness
* “Walks the talk” in terms of the company values and leadership expectations
* Inspires, motivates and develops others
* Builds relationships
* Collaborates and fosters teamwork


 This position requires that you pass a security vetting based on the current regulations around/of security protection. For positions requiring security clearance additional obligations on citizenship may apply.
   

  

 What you will be a part of
   

  

 Behind our innovations stand the people who make them possible. Brave pioneers and curious minds. Everyday heroes and inventive troubleshooters. Those who share deep knowledge and those who explore sky-high. And everyone in between.
   

  

 Joining us means making an impact together, contributing in our own unique ways. From crafting complex code and building impressive defence and security solutions to simply sharing a coffee with a colleague, every action counts. We encourage you to take on challenges, to create smart inventions and grow in our friendly and tech-savvy workspace. We have a solid mission to keep people and society safe.
   

  

 Saab is a leading defence and security company with an enduring mission, to help nations keep their people and society safe. Empowered by its 22,000 talented people, Saab constantly pushes the boundaries of technology to create a safer and more sustainable world.
